items.title: Poor experience, find alternatives
items.review_text: I'm in the middle of my first experience with EMR, and it's awful. Huge queues, not enough seats, big prices etc. so I thought I would Google EMR reviews. Safe to say I am unsurprised at the ratings here. Will not use again, and will encourage others to seek alternatives where possible.

items.title: Absolutely awful
items.review_text: Absolutely awful! They take no accountability for the strikes they choose to have. They disrupt journeys planned months in advance with no compensation apart from “we can refund your ticket”. Who’s going to refund my Eurostar ticket and my plane tickets and all the other damages your strikes cause!? Their customer service is as equally as appalling responding with copy-pasted messages. Overpriced and unreliable!

items.title: Disgusting service and overpriced…
items.review_text: Disgusting service and overpriced fares. Everytime I want to go for an important work trip or holiday from the midlands to St Pancras there is a strike or some problem. £120 Train tickets fully cancelled, leaving me with no option but to drive or scramble to get a coach. You cannot rely on it. If you call the all-indian call centre expect them to not be able to answer any questions, understand you, have no knowledge of local EMR stations.  If you ever make it on one of the trains expect WiFi that just doesnt work, uncomfy crampt seats, litter and no luggage storage. Joke vs. all other european train providers.

items.title: Disgruntled Customer
items.review_text:
Sent from my Galaxy
I wanted to change the train tickets for myself and my husband to an earlier time today. The Trainline App was only showing later times so went to the ticket office. I was served by a very pleasant man who issued some supplementary tickets which I paid £13 for but didn't examine. When the ticket inspector came round we found that our supplementary tickets were only to Bedford. We were told we would have to get off at Bedford but had 9 minutes to try to change them at ticket office. Obviously a mix up as the original tickets were Split Save ones from London to Bedford then Bedford to Nottingham. The lady in the Bedford ticket office was very officious and unfriendly and made me feel like some criminal trying to swindle the railway. I was then told it would cost me an extra £73 to get from Bedford to Nottingham so we had to wait over an hour in Bedford for our original train and out of pocket for the supplementary tickets. Good old Britain. Miserable railway staff, outdated ticketing systems and a train with plenty of free seats that we weren't able to travel on because of ridiculous beaurocracy and pricing!! Go to Amsterdam and you can buy all your rail tickets at the airport and use them on any trains!

items.title: I have never felt sick on a train my…
items.review_text:
I have never felt sick on a train my whole life until I tried EMR. First I thought I had a stomach problem but no. I have travelled many times on other trains with no sickness, no feeling tired until I have taken EMR train again today and felt very very sick. I tried to use the next toilet but was out of service. The train smells weird already and this really irritated my stomach once I got on. Not to forget, the WiFi is so so so bad. I was planning to finish important work on my way but nope, no good internet from one side and my stomach from the other side.
I will never book with them again.

items.title: Do not travel with this company at…
items.review_text:
Do not travel with this company at weekends or before after or during strike / work to rule!!!
They put standard class into 1st class carriages at a whim so you don't get the quiet first class carriages you paid for. Terrible terrible service over the past year. Hopefully the railways will get nationalised soon and the unions held to account and these companies no longer put shareholders before customers.

items.title: Terrible seating experience
items.review_text:
Travelling 1st Class Chesterfield to St Pancras return.
Seats have no springs, upholstery is ripped surly they can be easily replaced & recovered. Doubt they’ve been replaced or refurbished since the last upgrade around 10 years ago, WiFi almost non existent. Very poor experience! EMR need some serious competition.

items.title: delay repay has asked me to fill in…
items.review_text: delay repay has asked me to fill in further details and everytime I do it fails and takes me back to the first page, clearly an attempt to shirk responsibility or a crap website, either way pathetic

items.title: Polite, friendly and helpful every time
items.review_text: I often travel to London from Derby and EMR has always been fantastic. The staff are incredible polite, friendly and helpful. Any time we have had an issue whether it be confusion as to which train and where we need to be they have always pointed us in the right direction. Also when travelling with a newborn in pram they were great to ensure we got on safely. This treatment was repeated when I took my mother who was in a wheelchair. Would definitely recommend EMR to anybody.

items.title: Awful network with no service, support or communication!
items.review_text:
I had a terrible experience in February. The station was overcrowded. The platform staff were rude and unhelpful. There were so many customers on the platform nobody could board the train they had booked. I finally got on a train over an hour after I had booked it. Needless to say, the train was dangerously overcrowded too. No seats and very uncomfortable standing with little space to breathe!
I applied for the delay repay . I was refused because the train I booked still ran! However there was no way of boarding it!!! 
Finally after many emails, my refund was granted. However…. I AM STILL WAITING 2 MONTHS ON! 
I’ve had to send my bank details 3 times now. 
Still no refund!! 
What an utter shambles ofa busines!!!

items.title: Much better than last time!
items.review_text: Much better experience than a few weeks back when I was travelling from London - had to wait for a bit in the queue but it was so organised, staff there to help and really friendly. Hopefully they'll do this again next time it's busy!

items.title: Oh god
items.review_text: Oh god, here we go again. I wanted to go to London and back tomorrow (Saturday) and once again they are doing 'engineering work' on the tracks so all the direct trains aren't running, would have to go via Grantham on a nearly three hour journey with warnings on their website about how crowded it's going to be. Yes, because the train from Nottingham to Grantham is only TWO COACHES. Once again EMR have sodded up my plans, every single time I have to travel with them there's always something that ruins it. PLEASE can this company get taken over again, this time by someone who isn't crap and will charge a proper price for these tickets and not the rip-off extortion it is currently.

items.title: Thank you!
items.review_text: I just want to say a huge thank you to two amazing train managers who helped us to get from Luton Parkway to Nottingham in the middle of the night when our flight was delayed and trains were canceled! One of the lovely managers walked us to the hotel and helped to find a room! You restored my faith in kind people! Thank you very much!!!

items.title: Where do you start… cancelled or…
items.review_text: Where do you start… cancelled or delayed trains, not enough carriages to handle the volume of passengers, reserved seats never honoured, toilets not available. How is this company allowed to run a rail franchise??? Still these companies have a monopoly on a number of routes so what can you do???

items.title: What a great start to our London trip…
items.review_text: What a great start to our London trip bought advanced 1st class tickets with reserved seats find other travellers in them ask them politely to move no chance to stand the whole journey in a cramped second class corridor. Toilets were filthy with the floor wet with urine. Complained to the train manager just to be told it’s absolute chaos and nothing can be done only to complain well here it is then. Seriously this has been an awful service and I’m really annoyed given I bought these tickets months ago .

items.title: Awful service
items.review_text:
Awful service, taken over three months to get a refund for a cancelled service, and despite being offered a full refund by staff, they tell me that  £21 will be in my account in the next few days..

They apologise that they have been busy for the last few weeks with high demand (no surprise) but after three months its a joke.

I would suggest it would be easier and cheaper to drive to Luton Parkway and get a real train service into London from there, as this operation could not run water out of a tap, let alone a reliable train service.

I have raised my complaint with the ombudsman, as the timewasting is just ridiculous.

items.title: Appalling Customer Service
items.review_text:
Several things have gone wrong, to contribute to this Review, culminating in the off-hand attitude of the person I spoke to in so-called 'Customer Relations'.  Mind-you, looking at all the one-star reviews here, 'Customer Relations' must be a pretty dismal place to work.
In February, I tried to book a through ticket from Sheffield to Epsom, changing at St Pancras & Sutton.  This is the most convenient route with luggage, and a route I've travelled many times before.  EXCEPT - this time, I was unable to book it online.  The computer wanted to route me via Vauxhall.  So I tried at Sheffield Station ... the very helpful person in the booking office couldn't do it either.  I was forced to buy THREE separate tickets.  Inconvenient and undoubtedly more expensive.
EMR's website is linked to the Black Hole of Communications.  I never received a reply to my query about how to book the ticket using the route I wanted, nor an acknowledgement of my Delay-Repay claim.  When I phoned 'Customer Services', they said there was no record of either my query, nor the Claim (which is now out-of-time).
To describe the attitude as 'off-hand' really doesn't convey the total lack of 'service'.  And apparently there is nowhere within EMR to escalate complaints.
Hence this Review.  Unfortunately, if I want a train from Sheffield to London, there is no choice.  It HAS to be EMR.
Bring back re-nationalisation!
PS. For some reason, I can't print e-tickets either (despite having no problems previously).  If for some reason my phone doesn't work, the EMR computers aren't sophisticated enough to register that I have already paid for a ticket.  I would have to purchase another one.  Arggghhhh!!!

items.title: Appalling experience
items.review_text: Appalling experience 17th February 2024. We had booked tickets for Derby to St. Pancras. The train was full on arrival in Derby with no available seats despite us having seat reservations. I got on the train but was then stuck in the entrance lobby, rammed against the door with no ability to move. I'm 68 years old with mobility issues. I endured an agonising journey to London. Many people at subsequent stations could not board the train. Our return journey was equally dreadful. At St Pancras we were corralled into a holding area by rude, unhelpful EMR staff. Our booked train was full so we couldn't board. We eventually got on a train but the whole experience has left me dreading another EMR journey. The transportation of animals is done with more care and dignity.

items.title: Awful company.
items.review_text:
Frequent rail user. The service is always bad. The staff are usually fine but the trains are uncomfortable, seat reservations usually fail and the WiFi is pointless. 
I travelled on a different line (south west) and that was brilliant. 
For this much money you would expect far better.

items.title: Trains cancelled
items.review_text:
Trains cancelled, trains faulty, trains over crowded. Trains rarely have usb slots or any modern convenience. The only thing guaranteed with EMR is one of the above. No profits invested back into the business, just straight into the greedy shareholders.
Ive nothing against the staff, never met a bad one contrary to several reviews here..

items.title: Worst train service in the uk
items.review_text: Worst train service in the uk. Not in uk actually in whole World. Every time i travel there are issue. Either train comes late or reach very late. It stopped very frequently. Please don’t travel by this. Instead use bus not this. You Don't want to get worst train experience ever.

items.title: Incompetent
items.review_text:
I have a railcard on my phone, bought from EMR, and I need to transfer it to my new phone.
Contacted EMR with details of the card, and they said they had not issued such a card, but another company had.
I found the page on their web site which gave full details of my purchase from them (date of order, its number, payment, etc) and sent them the url of the page.
They told me they couldn't find the railcard.

items.title: Rail franchise should be taken off…
items.review_text: Rail franchise should be taken off whoever operates EMR. One night trip to London, from Derby. Had to stand on the outbound train as no seats available. Most toilets on the train not working. Door at end of carriage not working. Return. Journey - trains overbooked so couldn't get on scheduled return. Waited two hours in a line for the next train, which was packed, people standing, bags in the aisles again. This level of service for the current ticket prices is a joke.

items.title: EMR regional refund process
items.review_text:
EMR regional - Sutton Parkway to Retford 02/03/2023.
App confirmed on time, so purchased tickets on the way to the staion though the App. Train cancelled while stood at the station. An unscheduled train arrived around 30 mins later to be told by a grinning conductor that it was only going 2 stops instead of required 6 for the connection at Worksop. But continued to show on App that original service was on time.  "At least we can get you part way there" i was told. No good to any passenger trying to make a connection! Applied for refund for total journey price £13.60 as I could not make the journey required. Creditted only £3.60 at there is a £10 automated charge on refunds. I paid due to trusting false information provided in their app. Now its my responsibility to pay for the failure of their service and unreliable information given to customers. Disgusting! Generally fed up with other late cancellation/train delays/disintested staff/dirty carriages/overcrowding on EMR. If there is any other way to make your journey - please consider.

items.title: Delay Repay does work
items.review_text: Although my Norwich bound train was delayed (I blame Ely capacity and not EMR) I did claim delay repay through LNER as I originated in the North East. Mucked around by them and they passed wrong info to EMR over 5 week period. Once I spoke to Abbie in EMR customer services everything was sorted. What a credit to the company in what must be a stressful job for them. Please be nice to these staff they are not directly responsible for your delay or over crowding. They are trying to help. Blame the government and the barmy transport policies.

items.title: Consistently Awful Experiences
items.review_text: Genuinely a horrible experience EVERY time I have to use the railway. Dread travelling because of it and has seriously become a motivation for me to get my driver's license. Stupidly expensive for the horrid service and unreliable trains you get. Trains have been late almost EVERY time to the point where I purposely book an earlier time to compensate for this. Hope England can improve their railway systems to something that even half resembles the trains in the rest of Europe.

items.title: London  to Sheffield
items.review_text: London  to Sheffield. 7pm outbound. 5pm return. Busy both trains. Standing room only on return. The whole carriage is tired and dirty. The scramble at St Pancras is grim. Reserve tickets didn't work couldn't be bothered to speak to any staff about it. They have a great social media team and all the excuses but the fact is they're greedy and don't run as many carriages as they need, or clean the damn things. Drive if you can. If you're forced to ride then don't expect a peaceful experience.

items.title: Utter scumbags
items.review_text: Utter scumbags, basically an illegal trade. Never had a pleasant experience on their pathetic excuses of "trains" - Filthy, hot, cramped, late, not up to date with customer needs (no plugs, none or broken USBs, no announcements, seats like rocks, lack of food) And don't get me started on the staff, the most rude, arrogant, unprofessional bunch of fools I've unfortunately had to meet. That's when they can be bothered to check your tickets or man the stations. People don't pay inflated prices for lazy attitudes. Don't ever give this company a penny, travel a different route or a different company. Pathetic doesn't even cover it. AVOID. You should all be ASHAMED.

items.title: EMR Disgusting Over crowded Filthy Exhausting.
items.review_text: I recently purchased a return ticket to Alfreton from London. We took a total of four trains with  connections at Nottingham. Our first train to Nottingham was so crowded that we had to sit on the floor with several passengers by the toilet, which by the way was overflowing and out of order. This train was so full that the door would not shut properly, and the train was delayed. We consequently missed our connecting train at Nottingham. Our second arrived with only two carriages. It was utter chaos, again we were sat in the corridor by the toilets.  Our return journey was even more crowded from Alfreton to Nottingham and again at Nottingham we had to stand for the entire journey in the corridor.  The trains were disgustingly dirty the corridors dangerously overcrowded and the toilets filthy.  It was all in all a deeply unpleasant, exhausting set of journeys.

items.title: VERY BUSY TRAINS- MCR to NORWICH
items.review_text:
these are the worst trains ever. train from stockport to norwich is absolutely horrendous. do not travel this journey you won’t get a seat. do this stupid company think that 4 carriages is enough to fit people in for this route, especially on the weekends. they don’t even let you book a seat, such a shambles. i will heavily try to avoid these terrible trains as they are uncomfortable and so terribly busy

edit- further on in the journey it got a lot less busy which made the experience more bearable and comfortable. however they still need to maybe get larger trains for this service as surely emr, you can understand now how busy it has service gets

items.title: 17.07 is NOT 17.06; 17.24 is NOT 17.23!
items.review_text:
These people have zero time keeping skills. Go back to school and learn simple mathematics skills, or get your eyes checked so you can read LED digital clocks properly.
This is far better than making people on the platform at Corby miss their train because you're in too much of a hurry.
I will be driving to/from work in the near future.

items.title: If only we had other train options to go to London from Leicester...
items.review_text:
I have the impression I've written a bad review for EMR before, but their service continues to be so bad that this is probably just a reminder
Not only the trains are constantly late, more recently it became common for trains to have fewer coaches, forcing people to stand all the way to London
But this review is related to a Delay Claim. Somehow their system allows you to buy tickets using either MasterCard or Visa, but now you can only receive a refund if you have a Visa card. 
Terrible quality, terrible customer service, nearly zero WiFi coverage that actually works, overall a terrible company
If only we had other train options to go to London from Leicester...

items.title: Avoid if you can
items.review_text: Within 2 weeks I traveled between Wellingborough and Luton Airport Parkway 2 trains got cancelled, 2 delays due to traffic light faults and one broke down halfway. That's  5 late to work days. Very dissapointing. And its not cheap.

items.title: This was one of the worst travel…
items.review_text:
This was one of the worst travel experiences I have ever had. Trying to get to Loughborough from London St Pancras. As per everyone else’s reviews, the queuing at London St Pancras is horrific and you are herded into queues for the trains like cattle. My train also had my stop cancelled with 5 minutes to go so then I had to research an alternative route to get to Loughborough. This involved getting a second train from
Nottingham but the one from london was late departing and so I missed my connecting train. The train ticket was very expensive and I cannot believe how poor the service was for the money. 

If you have the time and it’s not too far, I would recommend travelling to/from Newark Northgate and using LNER - they are a much better rail service, cheaper and King’s Cross is far nicer than St Pancras. I will never use EMR again.

items.title: Platform change at literally the last…
items.review_text: Platform change at literally the last minute , not everyone made it because we had 2minutes to change platform from 1b to 6a , I told the platform attendant there was a lady with a pram coming down in the lift several times and he didn't give  2 hoots about her , she turned up just as we pulled out of Nottingham . What a joke , so the poor lady was left stranded to wait for the next ,absolutely disgusting treatment of customers ,let alone a lone female with a very young child . You seem to have no understanding about how long it takes to get from one platform to another or care

items.title: Discrimination against disabled people.
items.review_text:
Discrimination against disabled people.
I will be taken further action against EMR with rail regulations and trading standards.
I am disabled person who booked special assistance and a priority seat, however I got a normal seat on busy train next to someone else because it was busy. Furthermore a short period into the journey another passenger asked me to move as she had reserved the seat I was sat in.
This left me standing up for the remaining journey and it caused me serious pain. Please avoid these trains they are not fit for purpose and dirty trains too.

items.title: Nottingham emr train station Awfull they don't give much information…
items.review_text:
Awfull they don't give much information on there app or website if trains are delayed or cancelled or just go to a certain point. I tried to phone the 24rs telephone number they have and they man just told me he didn't know nothing he stated he don't speak much English phone back Monday keep in mind I'm supposed to be departing Nottingham today a Sunday.
The attitude on the staff is just wow no thanks not today yet they are quick enough to take your money and leave you stranded.😒

items.title: An absolute disgrace
items.review_text: An absolute disgrace! Poor to no service, filthy trains that are usually late. Every seat has a stain. Floors are covered in layers of refuse. No place to sit while waiting for what is usually a late arrival. First class is a joke. Fees for changing tickets online! And to top it all off, it's bloody expensive! Nothing good about EMR. How do these people look themselves in the mirror every morning? It's a shockingly poor operation and you should be ashamed that you are offering this service to the paying public.

items.title: Worst staff I've ever met
items.review_text: Worst staff I've ever met. shouting at customers and telling us we have to move but offered no assistance when we explained are luggage didn't fit. One staff member also told us we 'couldn't afford first class' and gave us a dirty looks. What vile employees! Disgusting behaviour towards customers

items.title: Wow!! ....
items.review_text: Wish I had read the reviews before booking my ticket to Corby. Theme is pretty much the same as previous reviews that I have read.....cancelled trains, overcrowding, not able to sit down, despite booking way in advance. Have spoken to customer service numerous times, sent emails and have even used Resolver to obtain a refund, all to no avail. First and last experience of using this utterly useless, appalling company, and equally customer service, who are not fit for purpose. Shame I cannot rate anything less than 1 star which I deem to be very generous!!!

items.title: Rude staff
items.review_text: I have used EMR quite a few times for local journeys, always pretty basic. On this occasion, I encountered the rudest member of train staff. I had a few minutes to catch my train, so hurried across the platform at the station. I arrived next to the train with a minute or so to spare, pressed the button to open the doors and then suddenly the doors locked and the train manager hung out of his window and shouted ‘I won’t open the doors because you couldn’t be bothered to move’. He then shrugged. He made a bold assumption - I am actually a disabled person who struggles to move - however his customers service was appalling regardless of the situation.

items.title: Trying to process a Delay Repay claim
items.review_text: Trying to process a Delay Repay claim. A complete faff, and then only to receive an email saying they cannot process a refund to my credit card. Phoned customer services: not enough staff on because their website is crap. The option to request a call back didn't work. Not resolved. Sigh

items.title: It is already the third time I am…
items.review_text: It is already the third time I am submitting an appeal against their delay repay calculations. Each time, they make a simple and obvious "mistake" which, surprise surprise, skews the sum of compensation in their favour. Surely they couldn't simply mistake my advance single ticket for a 7-day season one, which is what happened today.

items.title: Train left early
items.review_text:
Train from Chesterfield to Manchester left early on 23rd December, meaning I was delayed by an hour. No options on delay repay to reclaim ticket costs for trains departing early and customer service have completely ignored the email I sent. 

Fortunately, my area is well serviced by other train companies, so I will be prioritising them in future.

items.title: Absilutely NO refunds
items.review_text:
Well what a surprise. For a trainline that is sold out very often, they cannot issue ANY refund on standard purchased tickets, only flexible tickets that cost around 30% more. What a rip off. 

Any other company that is often sold out would say no problem as they know they will have this customer back. Now I will never use them again. 

Pathetic customer retention approach. 

P.s. Anyone want to fare dodge, you can push through St Pancras barriers as they always announce last-monute platforms and open the gates anyway. On return, their staff witness people pushing through barriers and they dont do anything... next time ill push thorough myself!!! 

Bye bye and enjoy your free money from me...

items.title: Misery on Rails
items.review_text:
Disappearing services, dirty, smelly trains, broken doors and loos, derelict buffet cars mythical trolley services. Expensive compared to similar journeys by other TOCs, just to rub salt into the fetid wound that is rail privatisation. 

If you're planning to travel with EMR, make sure you have a backup plan and that all your vaccinations are up to date.

items.title: EMR have an intentionally poor UI
items.review_text:
EMR have an intentionally poor user interface for their Delay Repay, which makes attempting to claim money that you're entitled to more difficult to redeem.

In contrast, I found LNER was able to process and repay my claim within 24 hours. EMR can and should do better.

items.title: Rubbish company, zero customer service
items.review_text:
We have two first class tickets to go to London *from Boston)  this weekend. When we booked them  a few weeks it was a simple change at Nottingham.
Now they've changed the timetable (nothing to do with strikes or overtime bans) and there are NO EMR trains from London to Nottingham on Sunday - the day we HAVE to return. 
So use a different operator. Love to, but our tickets day,  "valid on EMR ONLY".  So here we are two first class return tickets for this weekend - which are WORTHLESS!

items.title: Booking tickets is frustrating
items.review_text: Just had the most frustrating experience trying to book a ticket for a journey on East Midlands. Neither their app nor the website seemed to be able to process payments, despite me trying several times with various cards. Now we'll have to turn up at the station tomorrow and hope we can get tickets last minute or risk cancelling our trip.

items.title: Shouldn’t be allowed to operate.
items.review_text: I can’t believe this shower have got 1.7 stars, who’s giving more than the mandatory 1???  The worst company I’ve ever had the misfortune to use.  Standing again now having paid for a first class ticket.  No refreshments, no apology, staff hiding away because the carriages are full of people either standing or having to sit outside toilets.  Shocking.  And having stood alongside an elderly lady at the end of the first class coach, after 20 odd minutes and 2 stops an EMR staff member gets up from a first class seat and leaves the coach, having been looking at fare paying passengers standing all along.  Unbelievable.  I really don’t know have they haven’t been stripped of the licence to operate.  Seriously considering travelling to Huntingdon in future to use LNER, a proper train service.  Shouldn’t have to add another 40 minutes each way to your journey, just to avoid arriving at every destination angry and feeling robbed!!

items.title: It you get on a train at Nottingham
items.review_text: It you get on a train at Nottingham, everyone has to queue up and use one door to have their ticket scanned! Why? 😡

items.title: Disappointing
items.review_text:
Train back from Nottingham to St Pancras was mobbed with Brighton football fans who were sitting in other passengers’ seats hence we couldn’t board the train or take our booked seats. The man at the ticket office was unhelpful and told me it wasn’t a plane and I had no rights. Managed to get on another train but an hour later. 
Almost 3 weeks now since I complained to EMR but no reply.

items.title: My granddaughter Abandoned on train in wheelchair
items.review_text:
Out bound from derby to Sheffield refused travel as there was 2 wheelchairs on board already had to wait till next train.
Return Sheffield to derby no body at derby to get me off was left on train there’s no emergency procedure, no button to press for wheelchair users, no number to ring. She was stuck until her mum told them she was there they got her off further down the line then return back on a different train wonder how long it would have been before anybody realised she was there. 
No other travellers offered to help her just pushed past her to get off or on shame on you.
Don’t trust this company with your loved ones they don’t care about disabled travellers even if you booked assisted travel

items.title: Appalling, do not travel with them
items.review_text: Our return journey from St Pancras to Sheffield was appalling. I would have given this no stars but it doesn't appear to be an option. Arrived 20 minutes before our train was due to leave St Pancras on which we had booked seats only to be told our train has left early as it was full. We were then moved into a holding area to wait for an hour and 45 minutes. There was no access to seats, we didn't dare leave the area as the queue behind was so long we feared we wouldn't get on the next train. This meant no access to toilets, food and drink for nearly two hours with our two children. We did make it on to the train, however it was rammed. There was confusion over whether we could sit on reserved seats and there were no members of staff to be seen on the train to deal with this. As the train was so full, access to the toilets and snack bar became impossible. I will not be travelling on this line again unless absolutely necessary. If you have mobility problems I would seriously suggest you do not travel with this company as they don't treat their passengers like human beings but more like cattle.

items.title: shockingly bad
items.review_text:
Travelled on a Sunday and it was such an awful experience. 
Train was 10 minute delayed, staff angry rude, and unhelpful. Seat reservation screens not working, which was very stressful as we had booked in advanced with reserved seats and had a new baby with us. No room for buggy, had to use wheelchair spot and be on alert the full time. 
Overhead storage could not fit even medium size travel bags, only small bag packs. 
Baby changing toilet out of order. 
Very slow, busy train with dirty seat. 

Overall very stressful and upsetting experience

items.title: Worst rail company
items.review_text: Unsafe trains, always delayed, Always dangerously overcrowded to the point of creating medical issues and leaving people at the station due to overcrowding, all around terrible service. Don't bother complaining because they'll just spew lies at you and never do anything to fix the issue or offer compensation or discount. Should be considered embarrassment to rail industry. Put 4th of September as date but the same issue has happened almost everyday since then.

items.title: Friendly train staff shame about the train
items.review_text: Friendly train staff detailed information and reminder to take stuff when leaving train. Return train on time.  Train seats well worn and looked dirty.  One toilet out of order others filthy - no signs saying where they were - not that you wanted to use them when found! Ordered seat online. Backwards facing no legroom seat allocated to me even tho there were many forward facing table seats not reserved on return journey.  Unfortunately emr seem to have a monopoly on train journeys from sheffield/ chesterfield to London:-(

items.title: Locked Out
items.review_text:
I went to log into my account to check on my smartcard. Couldn't get in, instead was shown an error message saying my credentials was invalid despite the fact I have logged in with the same password and email before. I click on the link to change the password, that was successful. Tried again, still go the same error message. Tried again with a third password change, also successful. Still couldn't get in. Third time, same exact error. 

Exhausted, I contacted EMR via their online form on  22 January 2024, describing the problem. Got a reply back with the representative asking me to send them a screenshot of the error message I was getting. I sent them a reply with the screenshot. Haven't got back to me since.

On 3 February 2024, I send the same person who contacted another email with the screenshot attached. To this day, still no reply. Because of that, I am permanently locked out of my EMR account despite three (successful) password changes and using both correct log-in credentials. 

Poor service! 
What am going to do now if I can't even get into my account if EMR are not going to look into it due to the errors I have been receiving when trying to log-in?

items.title: Grim again
items.review_text: Late train but need the patience of a saint and a degree in pointless paperwork to claim the Delay Repay. Awful seats and refreshments and a scrum down at St Pancras for the 2 ticket checkers as over 50% of customers tickets didn't work in the automatic readers (but strangely ours could be read on the train). Make Southeastern and Southern railways look like the Orient Express. Is it by chance that both St Pancras (Betjeman) and Sheffield (Tap) have excellent pubs within the stations as you always need a drink or 2 after using EMR

items.title: The worst Train operating company!
items.review_text: My first, and hopefully last use of this TOC (Train operating company)... delayed trains, lack of train crews, overcrowded services, rude platform staff and long delays waiting on their helpline... plus their website is not user-friendly when applying for rail delay... this franchise should be stripped from Transport UK Group and put back into public hands! If I could give 0 stars... I would!

items.title: Friendly staff, awful trains
items.review_text: Travelled from Sheffield to London. Original train broke down and was replaced by a shorter train. Got a reservation in carriage F or G? Not any more. Some passengers were told that reservations were cancelled but we’re still on the display, a bit of a shambles really. Train filthy with worn out seats. Will travel via Doncaster in future to avoid EMR.

items.title: 1 star service at a first class price.
items.review_text: I have no choice but to be a frequent user of this service at the moments and to say EMR offer a substandard is being polite. It’s over priced, never enough seats provided and if you reserved a seat 9 times out 10 you have to request someone to move out of it and this is all before youve left the staton. free wifi is advertised on EMRs, don’t be fooled as it doesn’t work. Put into simple terms if you don’t want to pay silly money for a 1 star service avoid EMR at all costs.

items.title: Dreadfull Train Service yet again from EMR
items.review_text:
Dreadfull Train Service yet again from EMR.
I was traveling on the 5th January 2024 from Langley Mill to Attenborough, meaning that I needed to change at Nottingham Station to catch the Leicester Train.
This was 7.27pm on a cold Friday evening, about 2-3 mnutes before the train arrived it came up that all the stops between Nottingham and Leicester has been cancelled and the train would be going straight to Leicester.
I went in the Customer service room (I use that term VERY lightly) to be told in no uncertain terms that the train is not stopping anywhere and I would have to wait 90 minutes for the next train.
I couldn't do this so at my own expense left the station and caught the tram.
Now if that was not bad enough I put a delay replay claim in and it was rejected, one can only assume that as they got me to Nottingham their attitude is 'Oh well we got you close enough'.
Don't worry about getting me home, oh thats right they didn't or refund me.

items.title: Anne and Peter, the kindest people
items.review_text:
I travelled on the 7:32pm train from London st Pancras international to Loughborough on the 16th October. 

Two employees, Anne and Peter were absolutely amazing. I was having an emotional moment and without even a thought they both took it upon themselves to help and look after me. I have never met such giving and kind people before. Please make sure this message gets to them as I owe them the biggest of thank you’s. East Midlands Railway is lucky to have such employees. 

Thank you so much,
Ellie x

items.title: Superb service
items.review_text: My partner inadvertently left his briefcase on a train this evening. Ajay at Market Harborough station went out of his way to help him retrieve it. He contacted staff on the train, they had it transferred to the next returning train and within an hour we had the bag back. Excellent service. Thank you Ajay.

items.title: FILTHY FIRST CLASS CARRIAGE
items.review_text:
Travelled from St Pancras to Derby in First Class in an absolutely filthy carriage. When I say filthy it couldn't have been cleaned for weeks and the toilet was worse and completely repulsive. 

I complained to EMR and had a limp and aloof response about their cleaning regime on trains which was total nonsense.

Shame there's no alternative

items.title: Worst service on earth
items.review_text: Worst service on earth. Paid 80 pounds for a 2 hour journey from London to chesterfield only to find out they overbooked the train. There are more than 6 or 7 people between all carriages and they gave the audacity to run a food and drinks service. All while people are drunk at 9am in the morning, forming non ending queues to the toilets. Full price ticket for abysmal service. How they are allowed to do this is beyond me.

items.title: Constantly late or disrupted
items.review_text: I don't take trains very often; however, 90% of the time, I have to travel with EMR, and the service is delayed or cancelled. Changes in Crew are a nightmare as you may get stuck at the station for 45 minutes easily. If EMR can't run services without disruptions, they shall reduce the number of journeys so travellers can plan their journeys more efficiently without being stuck at a station or missing their connections. 'Apologising for the inconvenience' doesn't make it any better.

items.title: Due to a late connection I arrived on…
items.review_text: Due to a late connection I arrived on the St Pancras platform 1 minute before my train to Market Harborough departed.  However EMR inexplicably close the train doors 2 minutes before the train leaves.  I watched the train leave and their employee on the platform then took great pleasure in telling me I would need a new ticket (which cost me £76).  If the doors close 2 mins early surely the departure time should reflect the time that the doors close, since that is the cut-off point as far as passengers are concerned?  Seems like a licence to print money.  I will drive to Market Harborough in future, to avoid EMR.

items.title: 55 quid for this?
items.review_text:
55 quid return journey. Journey out was a 2 carriage nightmare, not for the first time. Loads of people with cases off on holiday, barked at by staff to "make more room". 
Return journey late due to "operational problems". Lack of information as to when the failed train might come back to life. Carriages are still old and caked in filth. Overcrowded again, maybe due to other terrible service across the Pennines being cancelled? Whatever the reasons, this is the worst train service in the country.Maybe should try INVESTING IN THE SERVICE rather than sending all the profits to the lowlands. And that purple mascot thing and those annoying adverts were a waste of money.

items.title: Absolutely terrible customer service
items.review_text: Absolutely terrible customer service. I usually use GWR when I am at my Cornwall address but I came back to the midlands after university and needed to travel to London. The seat I had reserved on the train claimed it wasn’t reserved when in the carriage and I had the ticket to prove it was my seat and someone else was sitting in the seat I had booked. If that isn’t enough, I complained instantly online while on the train and it has been over a week and no reply. I am requesting financial compensation for the inconvenience and the service is disgusting. If anyone knows who I can speak to outside of EMR to claim against them and raise a formal dispute please let me know.

items.title: Late leaving, dirty and unventilated, unairconditioned train. Problems with compensation
items.review_text: The train was over half an hour late. When waiting the air condition did not work and the doors were shut in extremely hot weather. The air conditioning did not work between Boston and Grantham. When applying for a partial refund online the tickets were not recognised.

items.title: Terrible service
items.review_text: Try and avoid East Midland Railways if at all possible. Terrible service, trains are regularly delayed and often miss connecting trains due to this. Trains are never clean inside either

items.title: Never again
items.review_text: The service from Sheffield to London was so packed that people were standing on every single corridor and had their luggage all over the place. Even the first class turned into a loud, dirty circus. The toilet smelled like a rotten egg. The Wifi wasn't working. The staff attacked us when we asked about the situation by saying that we had other options and that we should go for them next time. What about this time though for which we paid for a first class ticket? Why do you sell tickets if you don't have available seats? Why do you let the first class turn into a zoo? I prefer driving next time.

items.title: filthy coaches and toilets
items.review_text: Travelled from Manchester to Chesterfield recently on what must be the filthiest train in the country. I when to use the toilet but preferred to sit cross legged rather than use the facilities. I’ve travelled on packed Indian trains that are cleaner that your carriages. Appalling !

items.title: Absolute joke of a train company.
items.review_text:
Absolute joke of a train company.

Just got off train, which arrived at destination late due to them following a slow train.  Now I have nearly an hour until my next train as I missed 2 connecting trains due to them running late.

Last time I caught this train it ran late and I missed my connecting train.

The apologise, but they don't really of the impact their shoddiness has on their customers who miss connections.

Currently sat in Sheffield Station waiting.

Note to self...next time use a more reliable train operator or get a taxi and send them the invoice.

items.title: Tickets cancelled but can’t be refunded
items.review_text:
train tickets were cancelled because of train strike. They never refunded me in correct amount, as keeping telling me record showing the expired tickets were scanned. How comes I scan a ticket in early morning as well as late evening after 14 days in train station and get them rejected anyway.
It’s only a tiny amount of refund, but the debate was just happened after the day when they warned me not scanning my expired ticket. They never offer a chance to investigate their ticket recording system.

items.title: Horrible
items.review_text: I travelled from St Pancras to Nottingham on Wednesday 22nd February and the journey was a nightmare. Filthy seats and rotten banana peels. The staff onboard looked like lifeless money-grabbers. If I must travel again, I won't be stepping on any of your trains. Disgusting!

items.title: No refund on cancelled train journey
items.review_text:
On 9/8/22, I had to travel to Lincoln for the funeral of a friend. My train was cancelled, but I managed to get there in time via other trains. 

However, I was only offered a 50% refund, which is against their own guidelines. And although I appealed this on 22/8/23, I've heard nothing since with 0 refund.

What is especially annoying is that there is no email contact with which to enquire about claims being processed

items.title: Super heroes work at train stations
items.review_text: EMR staff came to mine and my son's rescue after another train line left us stranded on one of their trains with no help to exit it. My son, who had just had his 21st birthday the day before, was in a wheel chair with a metal brace around his leg, and no way could he have gone over any gap between the train and the platform. EMR not only got us on a train but also gave us drinks and made an unexpected new stop for us to get home. Myself and my son cannot praise all involved from the train station staff to the train driver to the lovely women who walked up and down the trains to check on passengers

items.title: A dreadful rail company. Enter at your peril.
items.review_text: I have panic attacks knowing I have to board an EMR Train. The seat reservations are all mixed up. There is panic and confusion even before the train has left the platform - if indeed it leaves the platform. Delays, disruptions and be damned are part and parcel of EMR's customer charter. They simply do not care. Their delay and repay scheme is designed to put you off from the start and even if you are successful in spending an hour to complete it, they will simply reply that the train was never late. A shameful company to either work for or be a customer of.

items.title: Absolutely not fit for purpose
items.review_text:
Absolutely not fit for purpose. The fact that they even have the audacity to advertise that they have internet is laughable. And to note some tickets are £70+ 
If you need an internet service when traveling, use the national express. at least you get coverage on a motorway as the mobile coverage on a lot of train line EMT routes is poor.

items.title: If I had to this would be no stars
items.review_text: If I had to this would be no stars. First of all, they had SO MANY people standing. I could not get to the toilet. They were unreserved first class seats that people sat in (including me) and they were still more standing than sitting! It seems the carriages are getting smaller. Many people were stood hungry and thirsty as the refused to serve beverages. I do not think anybody booked first class as it didn’t let them. Overall, don’t use EMR if you have to.

items.title: Dog S*$t experience
items.review_text:
Dog S*$t experience, always the same with these guys, cancelled trains so more people on the next l. But rather than do the do the smart thing and add a extra carriage they cram everyone in like it's a Tokyo train. 
This country is falling to pieces because of capitalist a holes like these. Sick of it!

items.title: Nottingham to London
items.review_text: Took train from Nottingham to London St Pancras - filthy outside & in, seats & carpets worn through. This was the case there & back. Scrum at St Pancras Nottingham-bound with crowds allowed to build at barrier before being released like a cork from a bottle. E-tickets for some passengers didn't work but they had to fend for themselves as no obvious staff to help. Oh, & the tracks at Nottingham were covered with rubbish & one of the toilet blocks was closed. And WiFi didn't work London-bound. On the plus side the trains there & back were on time.

items.title: Appalling
items.review_text: Travelled to St Pancras from Sheffield on the 17th of February. We had booked our seats and were fortunate to get seated.The train was rammed. The buffet was closed and the toilet was dirty. The return journey was so much worse! We had to stand for over 40 minutes in a huge queue at the station with no information. Our train must have been full and we had to get the next one. The train was rammed again. I had to beg to get a seat for my heavily pregnant daughter. I had to sit on a table for 2 and a half hours! I was one of the lucky ones! We were treated like cattle in a third world country! On arriving later than planned in Sheffield we had missed connections and encountered cancelled trains so had to pay £45 for a taxi home. EMR should be stripped of their franchise.

items.title: AVOID AT ALL COSTS
items.review_text: My train from Peterborough to Sheffield arrived 30 minutes late. It was a two coach train. The tannoy in the first carriage didn't work. The train was terminated at Newark. The onboard guard said, after we all got off, he knew it didn't work so he put a message on the screen, too idle to walk through and tell us. The EMR reps at Newark were not helpful or sympathetic and seemed to find it amusing that we had to wait on the platform for 35 minutes and then get back onto the same train. No apologies whatsoever. EMR seem to think refunding the cost of the ticket is some sort of 'compensation'.

items.title: Don't Bother!
items.review_text: I am roundly sick of EMR and their staff. The staff do not appear to know when to use a rail card. My son is a student and uses the train regularly, some staff use the rail card correctly but the vast majority of them do not have a clue about on/off peak. They also won't issue receipts and display poor customer service when challenged regarding their non compliance to issue a requested receipt. If this excuse for a DFT want people to use public transport they need to get their act together and clamp down on the poor practices at EMR. There is clearly no point in having a rail card when the staff refuse to take them because they are not properly trained or don't care to know when/how to use it. And they have the audacity to keep raising prices. Disgraceful company that do not respond to complaints directly submitted to them. These numpties are rarely on time either when they haven't cancelled the train and then when they do cancel not bother to tell anyone. Too busy worrying about going on strike and further inconveniencing customers.

items.title: Sad day for disability on EMR
items.review_text: My return journey started very badly as expected. No time to get to my reserved seats then go told of by members of staff for seating in the wrong carriage. Very sad day for disability,"sheet" service avoid EMR

items.title: Terrible
items.review_text:
Terrible,

Two trains delayed back in Jan. 

Owed at least £100 as it was hours late.

Made a claim, nothing. 

Bunch of jerks busy striking cos they think the deserve to be paid like surgeons cos they did their job during Covid. 

*******

items.title: Rude staff
items.review_text: Staff can be so rude, usually never have a problem with EMR but one lady raised her voice with me and was quite nasty when I asked a question about railcards. Absolutely no need for it and made an already bad day worse.

items.title: Very poor experience
items.review_text: Caught the 10:25 yesterday from East Midlands Parkway. Paid for first class. Could hardly see out of train windows they were covered in dirt, didn’t look like it had been cleaned for weeks.  Wife ordered a Sausage cob for breakfast.  What arrived was 3 grey pieces of meat in a cob.  It looked disgusting to be honest.  As she said it looked like a good vet could get it going, lol. On the journey back from St Pancras 8:31 there was no staff at all for catering. So we got nothing they told us to make a claim for compensation.  I don’t think EMR are fit to run the service.  Maybe the franchise needs offering to offers.

items.title: Don't bank on your seat reservations
items.review_text: I honestly can't remember the last time there wasn't a problem with either the size of the train or the seat reservations. I cannot spend another trip fighting for a seat or sitting on the floor!

items.title: Really kind train manager
items.review_text:
I travelled on the 12.07 from Kettering to St Pancras today
When Martin the train manager asked to check my ticket he pointed out that I should have printed it at the station. I thought I had an e-ticket.
He told me he would print the ticket for me and explained that the QR code wouldn't work on the underground so to ask to be let through. 
He was really kind, professional and friendly and reassured me it wasn't a problem.

items.title: Simply....get that rotten advert with…
items.review_text: Simply....get that rotten advert with the most annoying song off air...I have to put the telly on silent everytime it comes on.....spend your advertising millions on your trains, services, staff, timetables, cleaning, ticket prices.  And the bunch of poop people on the advert....God only knows that the rest of the Country think everyone in Derby looks like them...baggy jeans, rolled up trousers, overweight and slurping drinks. Get a refund from your advertising company.

items.title: Health and safety issues
items.review_text: Our train from St Pancras to chesterfield was cancelled without any notification either speaker system or departures board . Herded on to the following train to find no reserved seats. Train completely overcrowded with standing passengers and luggage blocking aisles . I say standing ,one poor guy with a broken leg was actually lying in the crowded corridor linking carriages. Midway through the journey my elderly wife required the toilet only to find after several attempts reaching the toilet impossible. I’m sorry and embarrassed to say she unfortunately urinated herself before reaching our destination. . No apologies were given throughout our time at the station or on the train. The company are a complete disgrace and I have subsequently contacted the Health and Safety Executive to report the company for obvious reasons.

items.title: The Martin Lewis review on X is…
items.review_text: The Martin Lewis review on X is interesting. The response even more interesting where it is claimed that the problems occurred due to problems on the East Coast line. Whilst there are problems on that line which have caused an increase in demand I find it profound that EMR blame this one occurrence. I have travelled for several years from Kettering to St Pancras return and this is not a new issue. EMR regularly put on trains in peak times that are inadequate for demand. The rolling stock is also out of date and untidy. They are saved by their exceptional employees who remain pleasant and professional under difficult working conditions. Whoever manages the business should actually join commuters on this line at between 6-7:38 am and on the evening return to experience both the disappointment when you see a train arriving with 9 carriages, knowing that you will be standing for the whole journey (usually by the one/maybe two toilets that actually work) and then the cramped conditions on the train once you board, then the behaviour of travellers who in frustration make comments to your staff. EMR are unfit to run a franchise and should have it taken away from them. Just for being incompetent and forcing their employees to endure what must be awful working conditions.

items.title: Joke of a service
items.review_text: Joke of a service… you book first class to imagine having at least a seat but you end up with half a train and twice the amount of passengers. People having to seat on the floor even after having paid extra

items.title: Disgusting
items.review_text:
Disgusting, dirty and old train to Nottingham. The aircon reversed itself half way through and started pumping out hot air. 
On the plus side there was a drinks trolley (the first time I have seen one on EMR in years)
At least they weren't on strike I suppose

items.title: EMR “You should be ashamed of yourselves”
items.review_text:
Well what can I say! There needs to be an option for zero stars.☹️. 
The trains are filthy dirty, the seats are all ripped and in such an appalling state of repair. The windows are so dirty and the trays to put your belongings on look like they haven’t be cleaned in years. It’s a health hazard. I have to travel on this train as I regularly go to Sheffield from London and I dread traveling on this tired, forgotten route where filth and dirt triumph.
EMR you should be ashamed of yourselves.

items.title: The most overpriced trains
items.review_text: The most overpriced trains! Would try to avoid as much as possible, every single train line charges less than EMR for a trip to London. Their prices, trains, and a lot of the staff are shockingly bad. I am now travelling to a different train station further away to use a different train company so I don't have to use them

items.title: Total lack of concern for us
items.review_text: Not surprised to see their rating overall is 1.4. Awful experience today at both Kettering and with their Indian customer services call centre. An error when booking led to us needing to cancel our ticket at the station to re-book. The error only became apparent when the ticket had been scanned. They then would not give us a refund because the ticket had been scanned despite it being a ticket to travel on a train when we had not even boarded a train and were instead still at the entrance to the station. Total inflexibility and lack of concern for us from all concerned at EMR. In the end i was sold an anytime return,  this was £38 more expensive than the ticket i had already purchased online. Total rip off! The train was also freezing cold. No heating on despite it being 1oC outside. Obviously saving money for the fat cat shareholders.

items.title: Impossible to get a refund if train was…
items.review_text: Impossible to get a refund if train was booked through Trainline. Spent nearly an hour on the phone trying to submit a request only for it to be rejected. I could not get a photo of my ticket bar for on Trainline as the train was the previous day when I made the request. Instead I was told to upload my booking confirmation, only for this to be rejected. Absolute joke. Make it so hard that no one bothers to make a claim.

items.title: I traveled yesterday from Leicester to…
items.review_text: I traveled yesterday from Leicester to London, my ticket was bought via trainpal but my tickets were split and it only left me with two mins for change overs. I spoke with a lovely ticket lady on the 12.13 train and she was able to help fix everything so I could stay on the same train rather than change over trains, as it made no sense. Also on the way home I spoke to Andraea at the ticket office at St Pancreas and she was very helpful at providing an extension ticket to get me safely home so I wouldn't have to change at Kettering station in the dark. Excellent service guys. Thank you x

items.title: Extremlly poor and crap service
items.review_text: Extremlly poor and crap service, taking a lot of money not really felxibke if you miss you train

items.title: EMR treats passengers like self-loading freight
items.review_text: EMR doesn’t give its staff the SLIGHTEST opportunity to show some common sense and discretion and forces them to stick to “computer says no”.  I had a ticket for an 1105 train and was an hour early.  There was plenty of room on the 1005 according to the barrier staff AND the train manager.  But EMR would rather make its “valued customers” sit on a platform for an hour and let a train go with dozens of extra seats.  If trains are busy, it makes sense.  But not when they’re empty.  Finally, the ticket desk is a ten minute walk from the platform so it’s not possible to just pay for a change.

items.title: 5 stars for Tom!
items.review_text: There were no seats on our jam packed train from London so my twins and I sat on the floor between the doors. Tom, the train manager, went above and beyond to seat us together once the train got going, and made sure that we were all happy and comfortable. He is a credit to this company. His friendly and reassuring manner was so heartwarming in a world where often, the personal touch is forgotten. Thank you Tom! 5 stars for you!

items.title: Cedric
items.review_text: Hello,  I’d like to compliment Cedric, an employee of East Midlands Railway who  helped us on 4th April to sort out our train to Leicester.  He was helpful cheerful and amusing and he helped make our journey very pleasant

items.title: Praise to train staff member on train
items.review_text:
Just want to praise staff member who took a fair but hard line with two lads causing a bit of trouble from Manchester to Sheffield.
He got them escorted off the train.
Thanks from all passengers who want a peaceful and pleasant journey. It takes some courage to confront people these days.

items.title: Don't travel with EMR!
items.review_text: Don't travel with EMR. The service they provide is absolute S***. They don't care about passengers. They put 2 carriges on at the busiest times, they expect you to squash in together like sardines. People coughing and splurting everywhere, you can catch all illnesses as the trains aren't even clean! How they can charge so much money for this service. I think the staff at the platforms are also quite useless as they stand in groups talking all day. It seems quite a surprise to them when you have to break them apart and ask questions and they don't like it yet thats what they get paid for. They provide the most stressful journeys. Don't bother, look for alternative transport.

items.title: Poor service
items.review_text: Poor service, old noisy trains that are expensive and not clean. Train was cancelled and next service was delayed.

items.title: Oversell of tickets and the worst client service
items.review_text:
There is nothing I can hate more, when I pay for a ticket and I don’t have a seat available where I can sit. This happened today. If people are paying for a ticket it is their right to have a seat. 
On top of that, I just wanted to ask a question to the lady who was selling food why there was so many people, and she just told me to not speak to her because she had a bad day, and on top of that I did not speak English well. This was the worst part of it, I don’t know how you treat visitors or foreigners but this has been the worst experience I ever had in a train. For this experience the minimum I should expect is to get my money back.

items.title: EMR service is some of the worst I've seen, and there is plenty of competition!
items.review_text: Firstly the departure boards said 'board any train as soon as possible'. Second the escalators in St Pancras weren't working (not EMR's fault, but people were struggling with huge bags). Thirdly the staff were just herding people into queues - lots of people went into the wrong queue. The Sheffield queue ended up literally right around the station. Fourthly when I got to the front I was just shouted at to 'GET ON, JUST GET ON!' I had a reserved First Class ticket but no way could I get to it inside the train as it was rammed and I had luggage too. Fifthly there was no attempt at trying to help people with onward connections (like some train companies do). Sixthly I had to stand all the way to Sheffield, missed my connection like loads of other people and EMR were nowhere to help. Loads of people then got the next train North and so ... had to stand again. Seventhly this dire service apparently allows for 25% refund because it was only 27 minutes late - no refund for having to stand or missing connections or just being treated like cattle. Eighthly the EMR Website is a nightmare of poor programming (including a drop down that appears everytime a new page is displayed, and every time has to be clicked passed). and Ninethly even their 'contact us' form is poor as you have to give a wholly unrelated reason for you complaint to get a complaint email sent.

items.title: Usually okay but recently have had so…
items.review_text: Usually okay but recently have had so many delays and cancellations without letting any of the passengers know until 20minutes to 2 hour hours later. Unacceptable. Missed last 3 appointments because of train delays with EMR

items.title: 2 carriages!!
items.review_text: 2 carriages!!! Really!!..crammed in like sardines..stood all the way from Norwich to Peterborough & still people standing to Sheffield...full price tickets...you should be ashamed of yourself...not a people's service at all..😡

items.title: Praise where its due.
items.review_text:
The St Pancras-Corby service had a lot of cancellations in the evening so when I arrived to return back to Wellingborough at 1645ish I wasn't sure how I was going to get back. No problem, the 1705 Nottingham service must've had a Special Stop Order for Wellingborough and it was the first stop. Apart from a short speed restriction, the journey was quick (under 50 minutes) uneventful.
I do tip my hat though to the onboard team. Smiling and happy, very polite and spent a lot of time throughout the train. I thought it was a very pleasurable journey that I'd be happy to recommend to others. 
The odd thing is that I live 5 minutes away from Northampton Station but whenever I need to go to London, I'd rather drive to Wellingborough and get the EMR service.

items.title: Totally appalling in every way , zero stars
items.review_text:
Trustpilot really need to bring in zero stars for certain totally useless and diabolical companies

For third time this year, train rammed . Cattle going to market would be far more comfortable by a mile 

No seats in first which we paid for, or standard . Not even any standing room , crammed in like sardines . 

If they’d been an emergency stop I’d hate to think of the casualties . Carriages hot and stuffy , crammed so close , nice spread of germs I’m sure , well I know as caught flu day after , as did my wife who travelled with us . 

If that purple thing appears on the tv one more time , I swear to god ….

Overall , appalling. To add insult to injury , I complained , they asked for tickets which were supplied same day , now 22 days after complaining , nothing , zero .

As bad as it gets , awful awful awful ! If only one had a choice , would never ever use these characters

items.title: shame on you
items.review_text:
change tickets prices whenever they want ,  tickets are much too expensive in relation to the distance . 
don’t recommend at all.
where is the regulation for it ???

items.title: Disgusting. Terrible company.
items.review_text:
I was travelling from Durham to Nottingham, Newark was the middle station of the journey and when I arrived at Newark Castle station the screen informed about my journey having been cancelled. There was no information desk, no station staff at all, no information on the one and only screen and when I called EMR for information, the person on the phone said he could not provide any information, because I had not booked the journey on their site!! 

I waited for over an hour and then another passenger came and she said there would be another train later. I had to wait for 50 minutes in total.

Disgusting!! Total disrespect to the passengers who actually PAY MONEY for the tickets, it is not a free service!!

items.title: Nightmare return journey & all dumped at chesterfield to find our own way home.
items.review_text: No problems with our journey to london but OMG what an appalling and unacceptable journey back. Realised there was a problem when we saw hundreds of people queuing for Sheffield trains that were either cancelled or delayed. We were pushed into the late 1.35 train when ours was due to leave at 2.02. But chaos with pushing and shoving and as I am disabled there were no seats and no staff to help due to staff not daring to pass the queuing passengers who were expecting to get to Sheffield. 3 trains worth of passengers pushed onto this train. The time for arrival got changed so many times and then we were all made to get off at Chesterfield train station. Chaos as there were too many people to get on and we got back 18.40 nearly 3 hours later.as one train was over an hour later and others cancelled so we were stranded. Appalling and not sure if I will renew my rail card. All the guy kept saying was claim compensation!

items.title: Norwich to Stockport
items.review_text: Norwich to Stockport, so 4.5 hours no change. Leaves at 5.50am, nothing open at the station, but no worries I will get a coffee on the train. Fat chance, no services at all. So naive to think there would be I guess. Travelling by train anywhere in the UK is always a sh** experience. It's all broken, so next time I will add to the world's pollution and go by car.

items.title: Shocking service today from EMR trains
items.review_text:
Shocking service today from EMR trains. Got on at St Pancras at 930am not arriving into Sheffield until after 1300hrs booked first class but no catering facilities due to staff shortages 
Absolutely disgraceful service

items.title: LOVE EAST MIDLANDS RAILWAYS
items.review_text:
We are so grateful tovEAST MIDLANDS RAILWAY FOR THE SERVICE THEY PROVIDE.
But please where do you ask a question?
For instance, this Saturday we are going to Gatwick with an online booking.  We have to charge our credit card on any Station…but Not Mansfield ( where we will begin our journey! ) So what do we show the ticket inspector checking tickets Mansfield tovMnottingham ? We are old codgers and worried about this … so can anyone advise us and put us out of our misery?
Sincere thanks if you can. p.s. Love E.M.R.

items.title: Total shambles
items.review_text: Total shambles. On train from London to Loughborough. Heaving. No seats as train before us cancelled . People from that train got our seats and would not give them up. This happening to more than us. As I have  arthritis of the spine I cannot stand for long periods. Have resorted to sitting on the loo!! No good or drink except water when pushed for it, despite having a first class ticket. My  first time with EMR but definitely my last. Outward journey no choice of breakfast roll and no hot chocolate . Not a patch on LNER

items.title: A very wonderful member of staff
items.review_text: I want to thank the lovely Justine for her excellent customer service. I travel the same route every couple of weeks and she is always very helpful and very kind. She goes above and beyond to make sure I get the right tickets and any extras that I'm entitled to. She always says hello and she is just a lovely person. She has infact restored my faith in humanity thank you Justine 😊

items.title: PATHETIC
items.review_text: There's no other alternatives to this ... but 'you aint' gonna get any refund' would be a summary. My train was over 2.5 hours delayed, ruined a visit to meet a friend travelling from overseas ... and this is a pathetic service.

items.title: fumes in carriage!
items.review_text: Rubbish wifi. Overbooked train. It is beyond belief that in these days a company in the UK would use this very old diesel trains that let the fumes into the carriage, which is the worst of all. They are noisy too! Don't these people have a conscience, lining their pockets like this?

items.title: Outgoing train was 20 minutes late and…
items.review_text:
Outgoing train was 20 minutes late and then stopped early and wouldn’t run to destination. Had to swap trains.
Train home stopped early, had to swap to a bus…..bike wouldn’t fit on bus, had to have family come be collect me

items.title: Useless
items.review_text: Train delays, canelations lack of carriages! When will they get people who want a job and managers who can manage! We had a 1.5 hr delay waiting for a bus, its appalling!

items.title: I wish I could give a zero
items.review_text:
I wish I could give a zero. I have the misfortune of having to get a season pass with these guys. Not only is it extortionate (nearly £11k per annum between Leicester and London) it’s also the worst service you could imagine. First class is a dump - the coffee tastes as awful as it looks. Most of the staff have a serious attitude problem and the useless guys at the barriers at Leicester spend most of their time with their hands in their pocket chatting to one another with not a care in the world about customers. Quite how it takes 5 of these folk to man a couple of barriers is beyond me. 

Biggest problem has to be lack of communication; it’s like they’re allergic to sharing info and you’re just stood there waiting and guessing. Refunds are a nightmare to get too. But apologies are handed out free - they’re good at that. BTW if it’s internet you’re looking for, look no further than your mobile phone because the on-board Wi-Fi sure as hell doesn’t work most of the time. 

Save your money. Walk.

items.title: Unflexible
items.review_text: Hello, I used your train service this weekend to go from Nottingham to Manchester and back. The train on the way there went smoothly. On the way back, we wanted to get a slightly earlier train back (also a super off peak train with no different in price). We spoke to the ticket office in Manchester station who told us that would be no problem as the train still had free seats that we wanted to get on. The ticket inspector came round and we explained we had paid full price for tickets and what we had been told at the station. The ticket officer said we needed to buy completely new tickets or we’d be met by the revenues collector (offering us a £100 fine, to pay full price ticket again and a police caution). I find this completely unfair as we’d of never got on this train had we known we were expected to get completely new tickets. I offered to get off at the next stop and wait for my later train- he said i’d be met by revenue collectors. In the end, I ended up having to buy 2 new tickets. I asked if I could buy the ticket online as the price was so much cheaper. Instead, he charged his price which was much higher. I felt there was no consideration for us on this occasion. We were told false information and then punished for their issue harshly. Very expensive train trip, met with customer service which felt unfair.

items.title: Diabolical
items.review_text: Booked two first class return tickets from Market Harborough to St Pancras. Our train was cancelled the next train was only 4 coaches long and was so over crowded even the aisles were full of people standing, so we got back off. The next train was delayed by 45 minutes which we boarded and found seats but obviously not the seats we booked. First class was declassified so was full with everyone sitting anywhere and no hosting service. we eventually arrived in London but very late. On the return trip from St Pancras we booked two first class seats in coach D, when we arrived at the train Coach D was standard class so we moved to Coach G which was first class but had to move because our seat numbers were booked by someone else. We did find other seats in first class but the toilet at one end of our coach were out of order and the electric door at the other end was faulty and wouldn't open so we couldn't access any toilets. About 10 minutes from the end of our journey a member of staff arrived and managed to open the door using the floor button. Overall an appalling service, before I booked the tickets I considered driving and next time I will. The only positive point was all the train staff we came into contact with at Market Harborough, St Pancras and onboard were wonderful.

items.title: Dirty train and surly staff
items.review_text: Apart from a dirt train. Something that should not happen for the money you pay. In the last few weeks I've missed connections as the second trains were leaving as I arrived. Apparently, the trains don't talk to each other...FFS. Anyway, I had a booked ticket but finished earlier so wanted to get on an early train. I asked a st Pancreas and they said "yeah, just jump on the next" I did this until just outside Derby when a ticket collector accused me of lying. She was very confrontational, and could not believe their ticket office would make mistake. I don't even record off the radio that how honest I am. She then said "she'd let me off this time" like she was doing me a favour. Awful service for the price. It was the 19.51 from Long Eaton. Fly, it's worse for the environment, but cheaper and you don't have to deal with ticket people who can't blend their foundation into their neck!!!!!

items.title: Ross the Trolley Dolly was amazing
items.review_text: A crowd of us went to Liverpool for a hen do. We went from Kettering to Nottingham. What an amazing journey we had with the help of the guy selling the drinks, BIG SHOUT OUT TO ROSS FROM SHEFFIELD. He kept us entertained the whole way. His singing and dancing and  humour was out of this world. He is a great assert to the railway company. Thanks ROSS for starting our weekend with FUN.

items.title: Fraudsters
items.review_text: Staff on the train always been great however their business practices and management are awful. With the cancellations due to the strikes I paid for a ticket for a cancelled train. Had two parts of the journey across a few days so had to make my own way to my destination and then planned on using service on the way back. Put in for a refund and was refunded one part of the ticket but it cancelled both. Explained to the staff who were perfect and aside from major inconvenience put it behind me. Then I get a threatening email from their "fraud" department demoing treble the payment or be prosecuted. Despite the threats (who would have intimidated most) I explained and they tried to negotiate a cost despite having paid for the journey already.
