If I could use anyone else I would but I'm stuck with them. Been a loyal customer for over 15 years who's spent thousands with them to be treated like that. Appalling!!!

items.title: Train was so late I missed two…
items.review_text: Train was so late I missed two connecting trains. Awful service as expected at this point. Strike when you actually deserve better pay.

items.title: This is the worst trainline in the UK…
items.review_text:
This is the worst trainline in the UK unless you are not in a hurry, never rely of EMR to get to your destination on time. The staff are rude and the services are always delayed.  


Worst experience ever!

items.title: Could it get any worse
items.review_text: Wow. Amazing how I can assume the service could be sensible when it appears not. 1. Arrive at St Pancras and some boards while listing platforms for train operators eg platform 2, just say for emr, Emr. Hint hunt for alternative signs. 2 wait at EMR terminal but don't look at board. It doesn't tell you when to board. In the end the guy on the platform gives up and calls you down to the train. There's only 4 minutes left so if you are physically disabled forget it. 3. Get on the train and find your reserved seat. When you find it sitting in a wheelie bin would be cleaner and more comfortable. The sign says it's not reserved too. 4. The chap in front if me has got on the wrong train and the  guard tells him to get off next stop. I point out the board announcements were not live. The guard says you have to listen for announcements. I'm glad I'm not deaf.  5.Clearly for business this seems useless. As someone who is autistic my day is already wrecked. Next time ill take the car or bus and never mind emissions. If this gets any worse I'll travel night before and stay over. At least I'll get to work with  a productive mind.

items.title: FILTHY DISGUSTING!!
items.review_text:
I booked my tickets online and I spent about £60 return to travel EMR.
As soon as I got in it was smelling horrible and the carpet was just FILTHY DISGUSTING with layers and layers of dirt!! Seriously why do you need a carpet on public transport!!??? 
Then I couldn’t find any luggage space as there are only two on each coach and were filled with small hand luggages that wouldn’t fit on the shelf above the seats as the space allocated was too narrow and it could only fit small backpacks.. 
Then I noticed how badly and filthy and the disrepair that the sits are!! I wanted to throw up as the red backrests from red fabric turned into black from dirt and it was all worn out. The seats were all stained and horribly filthy and as soon as I sat I felt the seat cushion gone with my bum sinking in and I could feel the metal bars poking on my thighs!! 
and then you have the refreshments trolley guy screaming every 10mins to move our luggages from the corridor as he’s passing through with his trolley.. 
Seriously this filth in there doesn’t worth a penny and it’s against health and safety! 
Disgusting!!
Pity we can't post pictures in here!

items.title: I am extremely upset with the EMR.
items.review_text:
I am extremely upset with the EMR.
My journey back to Sheffield was cancelled Sunday 18th February 2024, and there were no more journeys to Sheffield that evening to travel back. Therefore, leaving me to stay in Norwich overnight. I had purchased insurance on this journey and so I called trainline that evening and was redirected about 5 times to different departments, all of which did not help or were not open. I then had to book a trip the following day to Sheffield which was more expensive due to it being the following day. All departments and EMR would only offer a refund on the one journey that was cancelled. No help with funds on the more expensive ticket to Sheffield the following day or compensation. I have now spent a ridiculous amount on this journey.
When I then called EMR today to ask for some kind of fund or compensation for their mess up of my journey, they refused. They told me I should have called that Sunday evening. Trainline did not tell me to call EMR that Sunday evening when I asked how to get compensation, so how would I have known to contact them? The trainline and EMR HR is so infuriating. I spent 2-3 hours both Sunday evening and today on the phone either on hold or cut off the line. I have never been so stressed over public transport.
If I am not offered compensation for this, as it says on my insurance policy, I will very upset. I have spent an immense amount of money on travelling cross country to get back to Sheffield because of this companies mess up, not mine. And to then be refused funds and passed through every department because no one knows what to do is so time wasting and stressful. 
I will not pay this much money for someone else's mess, and for my week to be affected (not being able to attend work on Monday).

items.title: I ought to give Zero but there is no…
items.review_text: I ought to give Zero but there is no option for it. Very Poor train system, staffs are so mean and customer manager are the ticketing office so rude. So disappointed. Unprofessional

items.title: The staff working at st pancreas as at…
items.review_text: The staff working at st pancreas as at 21:00 23/01/2024 are all bunch of evil people. Devilssss !!!! No other way to describe them. I have never been humiliated this way before. My tickets was not working and I showed it to them. Then it was a white guy and a white blonde lady with curly hair. They asked me to wait with a horrible attitude, I did as I didn’t know the time were specific. On my ticket it say 21:15 and I was waiting patiently since 20:00. Then when they announced for us to board the 21:15 train, my ticket refused to work, I kept calling these people for help and they kept ignoring me and looking away, giving me this look like am not a human being while attending to others. At a point I started thinking if it could be my colour because I don’t understand. Then one of them an Asian man came and told me to keep waiting with a horrible tone and attitude, without wanting to hear me out. I had to literally scream repeatedly while showing him my ticket before he told me to go on that he didn’t realise my train was 21:15. No apologies nothing. I had to run with my whole strength to catch up with my train that was about leaving, after staying In cold for ages. My heart is shattered because I have never experienced this humiliation before. These bunch of devils need proper training ASAP or should not allowed to work with people. They lack all the qualities that make someone a human. No empathy, nothing. How can people be so wicked!!! You all can do better!!!!!

items.title: Last minute platform change 14th Dec 2023
items.review_text:
I was trying to get on a train from Nottingham to Derby, sounds simple enough. On the minute when the train was supposed to come there was a change from Platform3a to 6a. So I walked over to the new platform and had my earphones in listening to music as you do. However I was supposed to get on the front of the train and ended up going to the back of the train - I blame Bruno Mars - that’s who I was listening to ;)
Anyways when the ticket officer came I had explained I got on the wrong train. From previous experience this is the part where the ticket officers gets angry - charges me extra for my mistake and ruins my day. But on this day Thursday 14th Decemberi received an early Christmas present. The ticket officer “R. Philips EMR 2435” he was sympathetic and gave me an extra ticket telling me to get off at Chesterfield to go back to my original destination Derby. I was surprised and grateful that we has understanding and we even laughed at the situation. It’s people like that that make my day man. Thank you R. Philips I don’t normally enjoy taking the trains but today was a different day because of you sir 🫡

items.title: Reserved seats and bike storage too but…
items.review_text:
Reserved seats and bike storage too but both there were no space for any of them. No seats and also no storage. Storage was full of unknown luggage. The boarding staff were not even helping as they said the boarding us not updated. How can this not be updated in this time and era. It's 2023. ERA OF TECHNOLOGY!!!!!!! are we in the stone age?

Not recommend at all

items.title: Do timetabled departures mean anything to this company?!
items.review_text:
This company obviously doesn't know how to read a timetable, or at least understand what a departure time actually means. Got the 07:13 "EMR Connect" service three times this week, departing Wellingborough at 07:13, to arrive at Kettering 07:21 (departs 07:22) and changing for onward travel further north (something you never used to have to do). 
The first time, the EMR Connect was 10 minutes late and almost made me miss my connecting train. This would have made me late for work and causing a great deal of trouble.
The other two times, the train conductor obviously can't read a timetable as it departed at 07:12. Why the hell is it called the 07:13 when it departs at 07:12?! The same goes for the Kettering departure - why call it the 07:22 when, at 07:22, it's nowhere to be found because it's already buggered off into the distance, having left at 07:21?!
This company is unfit for purpose. Timekeeping is bad, the Intercity trains are in bad condition, the Connect trains are 20 year old units that are in dire need of refurbishment, and the whole lot of them are filthy inside and out. The Connect services don't have any facilities and the Wi-Fi doesn't work on the Intercity services. Avoid and drive if possible!

items.title: Appalling journey, even worse customer service
items.review_text:
Everything about this experience was bad. The trains were massively oversold due to engineering works on the east coast mainline however, EMR continued to make sales and ‘reserve’ seats you had no hope of ever sitting in for a 3hr journey. We had no choice but to travel on this weekend and expected busy trains & some possible delays but the scale of the chaos was unbelievable. 

It started at St Pancras where on arrival (nearly an hour early for the train as advised) we were greeted by queues of people being herded into the upper concourse and yelled at by staff wearing EMR jackets to join one of three queues. Anyone who enquired about timings, journey options or indeed anything was barked at that ‘we haven’t got any information and we don’t know’. 

2hrs later in a queue with a young child, and unable to leave it due to no one to hold our place and not being sure if we’d miss the next train, we were shoe horned onto a Sheffield train where we stood for the whole journey, being pushed and stood on by other passengers and there was a single working toilet on the train. Bearing in mind that the company knew the works were happening but decided this was the weekend to make all trains short formed. They also continued to tell customers all their stock was out, when in fact they run longer trains mid week, and there were a whole lot of idle carriages waiting in sidings at one station. Shortly before boarding a well meaning staff member then started to announce that if you want to go to Doncaster catch the Nottingham train and get a rail replacement to Peterborough it’ll be quicker. And it would have been but they failed to say this 2hrs earlier.

 We then submitted a compensation claim to which EMR declined the claim and said the delay had been caused by our connecting trains so they would ‘pass it on’. Then it was declined because of course the delay was totally EMR’s inability to board passengers in a logical manner such as having standby queues for those without reservations instead of a big free for all. A further email to their complaints department hasn’t even been acknowledged. 

Greedy, uncaring company I will literally never use them again I’d rather walk!

items.title: I’ve just been to EMR Willesden which…
items.review_text: I’ve just been to EMR Willesden which is totally not pedestrian friendly. A young lady called LISA was an angel in helping me get an Uber to collect me after scrapping my car. Thanks Lisa you’re a ⭐️ star. All the best Marilyn:)

items.title: I had the pleasure of travelling from…
items.review_text: I had the pleasure of travelling from Narborough to Nottingham and the train from Leicester to Nottingham there was a conductor on board called jules. Have to say what a lovely well mannered young lady. Pleasure to see.

items.title: Service is often late
items.review_text: Service is often late, trains get cancelled and carriages are generally dirty, particularly the carpets and seats

items.title: Disgraceful
items.review_text: Bought a first class ticket London to Sheffield. Who is in charge of this railway? The train was filthy - rubbish all over the floor and the windows were  so dirty you could hardly see out of them. Almost none of the food items were available and the Wi-Fi was a joke. Disgraceful. Needs a major rethink.

items.title: Donna is amazing at Corby station
items.review_text: Donna is amazing at Corby station. She was so genuine and helpful, even guiding myself and son toward the awaiting train. You must be so proud. Thank you EMR

items.title: Disgusting trains and completely…
items.review_text: Disgusting trains and completely inappropriate trains for the length of journey and the amount of people. Get a grip East Midlands you are an embarrassment to train companies.

items.title: Remi and newton !
items.review_text: I travelled to Nottingham on the 30th October and when I got to st pancreas from Redhill I realized that I had left my purse at home meaning that I needed to go back to Redhill to collect it meaning I would miss my train from st pancreas to Nottingham. Newton and I believe his name was remi that worked on the platform at st pancreas were excellent in making sure that I had everything I needed to get everything sorted. They were extremely helpful and made this experience that could have been very stressful actually quite pleasant.

items.title: EMR - better than South West Railway!
items.review_text:
I live in Weymouth, where the 120miles to London takes 3long hours and the buffet service long since ceased even for First Class. Had to go London StP to Derby (21st June at 2002) and back (22nd at 1708). 
Fast train (130miles in 90mins) on time, helpful staff on and off the train. Good service, good train, good review. Would EMR take over SouthWest Railway please?

items.title: So yet again absolutely disgusting…
items.review_text: So yet again absolutely disgusting service on our return rail journey from London by EMR. We decided to upgrade to first class as the previous week's journey was herendous (had to stand part of the journey to Sheffield) on arrival we were informed there was no first class and all reserved seats were now unreserved!! So basically it was a "free for all" on a five carriage train!!! Some of us managed to get a seat but my daughter and her partner had to sit on the floor as did many other passengers. No onboard service provided and A/C not working (did not see one EMR employee on the train) all information on the train was delivered by Norman Collier on the tannoy system!!!. The journey from London to chesterfield took four hours where we were informed that the train had broken down and we would have to get off and wait for the next train to Sheffield BUT there might not be enough space on the first train so we might have to wait for the next!!!! At this point having lost the will to live we got a taxi from chesterfield. And they say privatisation is good!!! The rail companies are very good at taking your money but trying to get a refund/compensation is designed to explode your brain!!! BRING BACK NATIONALISATION!!!!!

items.title: Just simply terrible in every way
items.review_text: This time and every time, the loading of passengers is ridiculous! Change everything about the way you do it! Why do you hold everyone back until the last minute and then release a stampede?

items.title: Paid £95 for a ticket last night for…
items.review_text: Paid £95 for a ticket last night for today got a message that the person I was meeting is not well so can’t travel emr will not refund me for trying to keep other passengers safe f ing joke

items.title: Seats are unsittable
items.review_text:
The padding on the seats are so worn that there is nothing stopping the metal frame of the seat pressing into the back of my upper legs. I can only sit for about 20 mins before I start getting intolerable pains in my legs from it (this is not something I experience in any other part of my life) and I start worrying it is going to cause a thrombosis. So given that I regularly have to do the 2 hours between Sheffield and London I have a choice between standing and pain!
Luckily for EMR, they don't need to worry about bad reviews on here because they are the only train operator on the route, so they can keep paying the shareholders and neglecting their health and safety responsibilities to their customers. 
I will start going out of my way to get on a different line with a better operator.

items.title: Appalling service across the board
items.review_text: Train was delayed by more than an hour due to landslip, no information was given about how to do the delay repayment and that the ticket must be kept (I had the receipt which I assumed was sufficient) and the conductor even told us not to submit the claims until after arrival (by which time the machine swallowed my ticket). Claim rejected because I didn't have the ticket, despite having a receipt with ticket details and cost. On the return trip the following day half the trains cancelled, no extra cars provided so corridors packed with standing people for hours, toilets broken or inoperative, all in all appalling even by the low standard of UK rail transport companies. If you can, choose another mode of transportation.

items.title: Some of the worse customer services and practices I’ve seen. Rip off company.
items.review_text:
Only offer e tickets when bought in advance. If your phone dies you’re screwed and have to pay a premium just to get home. £220 from St Pancras to Nottingham normal class, I paid £88 return 1st class. If your phone dies before you get on the train and it dose not charge in time then it’s a stuff you, pay £220 to get home in regular class. I didn’t even get a bloody seat for an hour into my journey. Never will I travel by emr ever again, they didn’t even offer to offset the price of the old ticket for the new one which could have been the least they could do or bump you up to 1st as they have 2 coaches of 1st more or less empty and just 3 regular meaning you had to stand. The staff at St Pancras are rude and unhelpful in every way imaginable despite paying their wages. 

I’d rather go by coach in the future, it’s much cheaper and they don’t deliberately try to rip you off by ensuring you have to have an e ticket and a rubbish phone battery. They do this deliberately and jack up the prices at the station to force you into paying a whole lot more, they know peoples phones will die and be forced to pay a fortune more. It would have been cheaper for me to have stayed in London an extra night and got the train back in the morning for less than I paid for one ticket without so much as a seat.

items.title: Very poor customer service from the…
items.review_text: Very poor customer service from the ticket man, I was on the 12.45 train from Sheffield to Peterborough on 05/02/23. Shouting and humiliating people for no reason at all. Kindness costs nothing.

items.title: I would like to leave positive feedback…
items.review_text: I would like to leave positive feedback for an employee called John Smith (Smithy) who is based at the train station in Kettering, the man was kind, funny, outgoing and genuinely cared for my well being and his job, I needed help with my mobility and he simply went above and beyond for me.

items.title: So tonight I paid for a first class…
items.review_text: So tonight I paid for a first class upgrade. DONT BOTHER IN WASTING MONEY!!!! I got a bottle of water for my upgrade. Went to speak to guy, he is sat on his bum, and says… yeah I have no staff so water 💦 is all you get SHORT STAFFED. This is my first AND last upgrade (if you can call it that) BTW ALL flyers promise snacks/ meals. Complete waste of money!!!

items.title: Awful train service
items.review_text:
Awful train service

The trains never have enough carriages, they’re always overbooked and you have to stand. If I wanted to stand for the whole journey I would’ve walked.

items.title: Went to watch England play Ukraine at Wembley
items.review_text: Went to London thought i would try EMR what a mistake the train was filfthy over crowded and the staff looked liked they did not want to be there it was that bad i came back on LNER what a difference premier league travel compared to EMR non league travel

items.title: Insane prices
items.review_text: Out dated uncomfortable trains, ridiculous prices. Every member of staff you speak with seems to hate working for them.

items.title: No value for money whatsoever
items.review_text: I travel with EMR a lot and have been for over 10 years. Seat reservations work about 30% of the time, which always causes frustration and arguments when people try and work out where to sit. They always put on too many first class carriages, which are left virtually empty with not enough seats for people in second class. They always lie about why they are late - for example on a Sunday service which is already billed to be 2hours 35minutes instead of 1hour 29minutes and then is delayed by 20 minutes supposedly due to speed restrictions. The reason why the journey is already an hour longer is the speed restrictions, the extra delay is clearly something else so why lie and say it's speed restrictions? We're not unintelligent so why treat us like it? Carriages are always dirty, particularly toilets, I've been on trains with dried sick up the internal carriage doors. They treat people at St. Pancras like cattle when waiting to get on trains, they don't let crowds through the barriers, often until just 8-5 minutes before trains depart, creating stressful and dangerous situations. Catering services are regularly cancelled or unable to get through the train due to overcrowding - heaven forbid you might need some drinking water. All this for often over £100 for and hour and a half journey, so over a pound a minute of absolutely no service at all. I wonder what the execs have been spending the thousands of pounds I've spent on the company over the years on... Because it certainly hasn't been any kind of reinvestment. I imagine it is on absolutely any other form of travel other than an EMR train.

items.title: What a shower of ....
items.review_text: Why do they not have enough carriages on trains at peak times. Oxford Road to Nottingham packed. Glad I changed at Oxford Road and not Manchester Picadilly. What a shower.

items.title: Sheffield day trip
items.review_text: I was catching the train back to London St Pancras from Sheffield. I only found out on my phone that the train had been cancelled. I had to get the next train at just before 9.30pm. I didn't arrive in London til just before 12.30am. I was stuck in London til 4.30am. No-one from EMR helped me get home to Woking. When I filled out a delay repay form I got an email to say I'd filled it out wrongly, I hadn't. They just don't want to pay you the money back for a shoddy service. It's happened before too.

items.title: Myself and my son were supposed to…
items.review_text:
Myself and my son were supposed to catch the 22:47 train on 6th November from St Pancras to Wellingborough. We arrived on time only for all the gates to be red crosses and staff telling us that there was an amended service and the 22:47 train was no longer running. We were advised that the other options were to wait until 23:35 or go downstairs to catch another train to Bedford and pay for a taxi to Wellingborough.
The tickets were bought in advance through Trainline and we were never told of this change by EMR or Trainline. The boards at the station were still showing cancelled trains were running as was the EMR app and Trainline. Your staff were fully aware of these errors and apologised as much as possible but they can vouch for this. There were hundreds of others in the same situation at the station.
We decided to catch the 23:35. This service was also delayed en route. It was the slowest train I’ve ever been on. When we were parallel with the motorway we had HGV lorries overtaking us. We also came to a standstill for quite a long time. The announcer said this was due to engineering work. The staff also apologised for the refreshments not being available too due to staff shortages. Quite frankly it was a shambles. Me and my son had travelled from abroad and we had no food or drink. We finally ended up in Wellingborough at Approx 1:15am. Our original time of arrival to Wellingborough should’ve been 23:51. That’s 1 hour and 25 minutes late. EMR’s response is that it was an amended service so no refunds can be given. Absolute disgrace

items.title: Vastly overpriced and underperforming
items.review_text:
Vastly overpriced for the service you get. Compared to west midlands trains, east midlands are always way more expensive, even when you book in advance. But you're paying more for a significantly worst experience.

I will say that in my experience their trains are generally on schedule but the seat reservations don't operate more often than not, especially on Sundays. This leads to a lot of unnecessary stress and people being rude to each other that could all easily be avoided. 

Also if you travel in first class, you no longer get the free trolley service on a Sunday, which is a bit rich considering it still costs the same as the other 6 days of the week. The WiFi is appalling and half the time has no internet connection, the rest of the time it's so slow that it's unusable. There are plug sockets in first class but for some bizarre reason they are often disabled and don't work.

The staff are generally very friendly, I can't say a bad word about them, but overall the EMR service is in desperate need of an overhaul to bring the standard up and the prices down. I now drive over to Rugby or Nuneaton and use the west mids trains down to London instead. It works out a lot cheaper, takes the same amount of time, the stations and trains are less busy, seat reservations work and overall it is a much more pleasant experience.

items.title: EMR: Beware of Excessive Penalties and Unprofessional Conduct
items.review_text:
Very disappointing experience I had with EMR. Here are the details. I strongly advise against using EMR due to an extremely unpleasant incident during my journey on 08 Aug 2023. I encountered an unwarranted penalty and ticket charge.

My initial ticket cost was £35, including the railcard discount, but unfortunately, it was deemed invalid by an arrogant revenue collector officer who handled the situation in an unprofessional and rude manner.

Upon realizing my railcard was indeed invalid, I agreed to pay the discounted rate of £15 for the journey. However, the officer aggressively insisted on a fine, displaying a complete disregard for my situation.

To my astonishment, he imposed a hefty fine of £100 for the ticket, in addition to a £50 penalty. This exorbitant fine was entirely disproportionate to my regular travel expenses, which usually range between £45-£55. It was clear that the ticket checker's actions were fueled by a desire for retaliation following our disagreement.

Acknowledging my fault regarding the railcard, I promptly paid the excessive fine of £153.0 to avoid further complications. In total, I have already paid £35 (initial ticket) + £153.0 (fine) = £188. I requested a refund of the excess amount, but after chasing them for 3 months, they simply said, 'Sorry, we can't do anything.' Beware of such unfair treatment when dealing with EMR.

items.title: Cancelled train with no warning, shocking customer service
items.review_text:
I travelled on 27 December 2023 (strike day) but I had booked my train in advance and the specific train I had booked (11.32 from London St Pancras to Sheffield) was included on the new strike timetable, so I planned to travel as intended. 
However, when I arrived at St Pancras, my train had completely disappeared from the departures timetable - it didn’t show as ‘cancelled’, it had disappeared completely from the timetable. 
I got no warning or explanation about this from EMR, so could not plan accordingly. I then had to queue with hundreds of others by the tickets barriers, only to miss the next train at 12.02 due to overcrowding and then only just squeeze onto the 12.32 after a huge and scary crush through the single ticket barrier that the EMR staff opened. 
When I applied for a refund for my 11.32 train for which I had booked an advance ticket, I was promptly and definitively told that because my train had been removed from the timetable (even though I received no warning or notice about this) that I was ineligible for any compensation whatsoever as compensation is only for delayed or trains cancelled on the day. However, my journey was delayed by over an hour due to not getting on the 12.02 train after my intended train, but I have no way of proving that I could not get on this train as my ticket was for the earlier train. 
I later discover that EMR had done what’s called a ‘P Code’ where they change the timetable at short notice the day before a strike day without notifying passengers in order to minimise the amount of compensation they are obliged to pay according to their policies. 
This is evidently what happened to my 11.32 train. I feel undervalued as a passenger, denied compensation which is totally owed to me. 
I also feel sorry for the staff who were working at St Pancras the day I was travelling, because they were obviously doing the best they could, but their management and the management of EMR in general is in total disarray and is cheating passengers out of their own money. 
On my advice - avoid EMR at all costs. Unreliable, shocking customer service, simply a large company only concerned with achieving its goals at the expense of the common person.

items.title: EMR: the railway for people who love to spend hundreds of pounds on an Uber.
items.review_text:
The frontline staff on EMR are lovely - friendlier and funnier than the average UK operator.  I used to really like using their trains.  For any of you reading this - I'm genuinely saddened to be writing what follows.  EMR's management are to blame, not you. 

EMR canceled all its Nottingham trains one rainy January night due to a signalling fault and announced there would be no more service until the next day.  In this instance a train company is obligated by something called the National Rail Conditions of Travel (google them, Trustpilot doesn't allow links) to provide alternative transport, or if that's not possible a hotel, at its own expense.

 28.2 "Where disruption prevents you from completing the journey ... any Train Company will, where it reasonably can, provide you with alternative means of travel to your destination, or if necessary, provide overnight accommodation"

EMR evidently didn't have a workable contingency plan in place so the result was chaos.  Hundreds (thousands?) of marooned passengers, nobody taking charge, staff on the platforms saying they had no idea what would happen but instructing us to pay for taxis out of our own pockets then claim the money back later.

"But I shouldn't have to pay for a taxi" I kept telling them, "EMR has to".  "There's a shortage of buses and taxis" they said, "EMR can't get them".  I pointed out the obvious flaw in this logic, that if EMR can't find a taxi the passenger is unlikely to either, but it was brushed aside.  "You could wait to see if we fix the service" they said.  "But your website says it's suspended for the rest of the day".  "Yes but it might get better" they replied.  

That's not what "suspended for the rest of the day" means.

After an hour and a half waiting to see if EMR would reinstate the service, and being told several times it wouldn't pay for a taxi, and faced with a website saying there was no viable way to reach my destination, I had to bite the bullet, fuming, and book a £128 Uber journey (I pity the guy I met headed for London!).  It arrived almost immediately.  "Quiet night mate" said the driver, "there's loads of us free".  

So much for EMR's "shortage of taxis in Nottingham".

I got home an hour and a half late.  The next morning, p***ed off, I emailed EMR the receipt as instructed.  "We aim to answer all queries in 5-20 working days" said the automated response.  

What. The. Actual.  EMR's customer service team is so understaffed that it might take a month to respond and give me back my £128?  That I had to spend on top of the ticket I'd already paid it for!

So far so infuriating, but EMR's behaviour afterwards has been downright shocking.  7 days on, with regular reminders on social media and promises from its staff to chase, it still hasn't repaid my £128.  

If my company turned out to have no workable contingency plan for a foreseeable event, and suddenly had to tell its customers to pay hundreds to provide the product for it, I'd be mortified.  I would be grovelling, tearing out my hair and begging forgiveness and I would darn well mean it.

No such shame from EMR's managers.  Despite vague promises of an investigation the attitude seems to be "business as usual" and "sod off, we'll give you a refund when we feel like it". 

Yesterday, six days later, EMR finally squeezed out a halfhearted response to my complaint.  It flannelled about "having a care" for its passengers and conspicuously avoided discussion of any legal obligations.  It failed to explain why EMR lacks adequate contingency plans.  It said it was sorry for my "frustration" but not for most of the things it actually did.

Worst of all it tried to gaslight me that returning my £128, which I should never have had to pay, is somehow "compensation".  Apart from the (mandatory) delay repay nothing else was offered.

That's right folks, if EMR asks you to pay £128 to provide its service for it, and it later deigns to return your money, that's compensation.

Nice.

items.title: Should be zero stars
items.review_text:
Here's the letter that I wrote to Mr Will Rogers EMR's CEO and Mr Jody Ford Trainline's CEO.  I also wrote to LNER's CEO and he was very prompt and helpful in his response. 

As a frequent rail traveller, I feel that I have a fair understanding of the fare rules and problems that one might encounter when travelling by train.  Some problems that arise on trains are certainly matters of safety and maintenance and are therefore out of the hands of the rail line.  However, this past Saturday, 12 November 2022, I decided to use my one-month open return Chesterfield to London St Pancras.  I arrived at London St Pancras from Gatwick airport to board the 13:19 London St Pancras to Chesterfield for the return part of my journey.  As usual, I used Trainline to book and select my tickets.  I also used this app to select my return journey.  As I discovered, as evidenced on the attachment, all EMR trains that day were being advised to either walk or take a tube to either Euston or Kings Cross to use an alternative train to Chesterfield, as there were no trains leaving from London St Pancras to Chesterfield.  

Following this published advised and checking EMR’s live travel updates (also attached).  I proceeded, as instructed, to join the LNER Harrogate train that would require a change a Grantham in order to arrive at Chesterfield.  The following occurred:

•	After starting the journey on the LNER train (as instructed by Trainline), I was informed that there was no agreement between EMR and LNER for the transfer of passengers.  I would have to pay the ticket fare in full again.
•	I was repeatedly harassed by the LNER ticket master to pay for the ticket.  This caused me and other affected passengers a great deal of public humiliation and stress. 
•	The LNER ticket master also tried to issue me with a ‘non-payment of fare’ ticket and told me I would have to take this up with EMR.  I refused to do this. It was not my fault that Trainline had published false information and that EMR had not established an agreement for the transfer of passengers to LNER. 
•	I called Trainline to discuss a possible solution / recourse.  I was on the phone for 60 minutes.  I spoke to 6 customer representatives.  My called was transferred to a supervisor once, at which point I was cut off as no-one was available.  Throughout the course of the journey my phone signal was weak and cut off, which meant I had to phone back and each time I had to speak to a new representative.  This was very frustrating.  Only one representative attempted to call me back.  
•	Each representative was unaware of the EMR situation from London St Pancras.  Each one told me that I had an EMR ticket and that had to be used on an EMR train only.  This I understand.  However, when the instruction for every train that day stipulates a walk or tube to an alternative service, as a customer, I expect that advise to be correct and not misleading.  I also expect EMR to have a prior agreement with LNER to accept passengers following this advice. 
•	This continued stance from Trainline staff was very frustrating.  Even after the LNER ticket master took my phone, explained to them that they had published false information and that LNER would not accept any more passengers following this erroneous advice, they did not comprehend, apologise or offer a solution.  The LNER ticket master asked them to refund my ticket of £150.00 (First Class) so I could pay the LNER price. They refused and told me to send evidence of the issue and their complaints team would get back to me in due course.  Not very helpful in the moment.
•	Finally, the LNER ticket master realised that he nor I was getting very far and were not going to receive any help from Trainline staff.  At this point I had arrived at Grantham, and he let me leave to catch the connecting EMR train.
•	Arriving at Grantham I was told it was a two carriage cross-country train to Chesterfield.  
•	I called Trainline again.  I stated that I had paid £150.00 for a First Class ticket and now as in a Standard Class carriage for half the duration of my total journey.  
•	We discussed, yet again, the rules of EMR tickets and I needed to prove my position re the false advice published on the Trainline app.  There was no attempt to look at the timetable and see that every train that day was affected in this way and no information was given to passengers that EMR tickets would not be valid on these alternative routes!

All in all, this was an appalling journey and brand experience.  As leaders of these companies, you should be ashamed of treating passengers in this manner. I would appreciate an explanation of the events for this day and redress, if not a full refund, for the distress encountered, and the lack of first class travel I paid for.

items.title: The worst company I have ever used to…
items.review_text: The worst company I have ever used to travel. Late departure, rude staff checking tickets and toilets and seats look like they have not been cleaned since the trains started running.

items.title: Appalling service
items.review_text: They canceled my train and had to rely on a highly disorganised coach replacement service to go from one station to the other. Compared to train services in EU this is appalling.

items.title: not very happy with the way they book…
items.review_text: not very happy with the way they book over the phone to book a seat with E M R   they was not helpful for me with learning problem and not listening to customer on the phone. it will help if they listen to people. they do not help to book the time you want to go or  they cannot be helpful to pick a time you want. also they think you nobody at all only travel assistance were helpful  down side they can't book the tickets

items.title: The trains are absolutely filthy
items.review_text: The trains are absolutely filthy. Windows completely dirty. Not enough room to put luggage. Trains are often cancelled from Sheffield to London meaning you have to travel to Doncaster.  In this day of covid, its an absolute disgrace.

items.title: EMR put vulnerable passengers at risk.
items.review_text:
EMR put vulnerable passengers at risk.

EMR disgracefully ejected my lone 18 year old daughter from a train onto a dark empty platform at a small station near the end of her journey at 7.30pm on a Sunday night.  Her ticket consisted of 2 connected EMR and Northern trains. The Northern train was cancelled and she understandably presumed she could catch the next train to the same destination which was another EMR train. The uncaring jobsworth conductor inspected her ticket and ejected her at the next station telling her wait for the next Northern train. She sat there alone on an a cold empty platform for an hour at night petrified that an attacker might appear. If further trains were cancelled she could well have been stranded there. No concession given the for the extenuating circumstances. No opportunity given an to buy another ticket.

items.title: Appalling...
items.review_text:
East Midlands Railway is generally unreliable; my train in the morning is freqently delayed, and quite often in the evening leg of my journey there are no seats at all, leading to cramped conditions. However, I was not prepared for how bad the experience of travelling from Nottingham to Birmingham would be on a Saturday. Journeying with my partner, two young children, two elderly in-laws for a relative's birthday party, it seemed the quickest, most painless way to get us there. I had not reckoned on the sheer volume of football supporter passengers who were already drinking (and drunk) at 9.30am and who acted in an entitled, obnoxious and foul-mouthed manner all the way (including one group refusing to move so a woman could alight; she ended up having to get off at the next station, understandably furious and having had her day ruined)!

Given the huge amount of football supporters plus all the other passengers, some/most of whom had presumably purchased tickets in advance, the decision to cram everyone into only two coaches made for an uncomfortable, unpleasant and possibly dangerous journey - and quite obscene considering the inflated cost of the train tickets!

I hoped, as we travelling back later in the evening a good while after the football had finished, we might have a more pleasant ride home. But, no. Two coaches again, standing room only, people squashed together, smelling each other's BO, impossible to move or think or relax. Again, it is a disgrace what is charged for tickets and the absolute state of the service and the experience. We arrived home that night feeling stressed out and exhausted.

For anyone thinking I'm an idiot for travelling on a Saturday because...football...I reserve a portion of my disgust for the football supporters. I don't give a fig about the stupid sport and seeing these unreconstructed apes (including underage drinkers and older men who should know better) acting like they owned the train and being generally revolting filled me with a sort of existential despair that I don't expect from a ride on a choo-choo train. I kind of thought the game was a bit more civilised these days. I was wrong. Bunch of animals.

EMR...pull your socks up. Your service is consistently terrible.

items.title: Terrible service and worse Customer…
items.review_text:
Terrible service and worse Customer service. 
When our scheduled train arrived it was full of football supporters and the conductor would not allow any passengers on. We waited for next train, and same happened, so we had to get a taxi to our destination. EMR refused to cover taxi fee of £11, as ' the train arrived on time'!!
Terrible

items.title: Average Customer
items.review_text: Very expensive train tickets to travel anywhere.  Trains are often late arriving and late setting off. A lot of the staff on the ticket barriers just stand around talking in large groups completely ignoring the fact that you're standing there waiting to speak to them.  Unfortunately they have the monopoly on trains and there is only one train station in the area so have no choice but to use them.

items.title: Complete joke Filthy, Rail cars halved whilst still paying full price!!!
items.review_text: Complete joke. Poor punctuality. Filthy trains. They regularly cut the number rail cars during peak hours yet you are paying full price for 50% of the service. Did I mention they go on strike?

items.title: Horrendous company
items.review_text:
Horrendous company. Terrible punctuality, dirty trains, the list goes on.
Their (and many others) have the damn cheek to go on strike for more money when they are happy to provide such a shoddy service. Total joke.
Get back to work and provide a decent service then perhaps people will have sympathy.

items.title: The bar is low for train companies…
items.review_text: The bar is low for train companies currently but EMR actually run trains and communicate if there’s an issue, unlike other service providers, so I give them 4 stars. Just need to update the fleet a bit.

items.title: Wise up EMR!
items.review_text:
Dirty trains. I suspect no down time to clean them. Inadequate boarding time so “reserved” seats are lost. Uninterested staff always on the defensive mode (need one wonder why?). Overcrowding. Inadequate luggage space so knees under your chin IF you find a seat.
Seems all EMR are interested in is punctuality with no regard to customer comfort or safety. They would disagree but they would, wouldn’t they? 
Get rid of fixed train formations…… be radical EMR…. listen to your customers!
No wonder roads are crowded.

items.title: Fancy a Shower on a late train?
items.review_text:
EMR services can be summed up in a magnitude of words. Very few positive to say about the service. 

EMR constantly over subscribe their trains. You'll pay the same fee and expected to stand for the duration of your travel because they've over sold the train. This is a constant occurance - I imagine health and safety would have a field trip with this!

Not only this, train's are constantly late. Despite adequate travel plans, arranged around the incompetency of the UK rail services I've serverly been delayed on my journeys and have missed several connections. 

My most recent journey was less than satisfactory, as I eventually arrived at my destination (1hour late) drenched!!!
EMR are failing to keep up with modern trains (government inflicted) 
They're slow inadequate and leaking.... Significantly! There was a small downpour which resulted in the carriage being flooded from the doors along the roof and through several windows. Seats are damp and elderly people are standing as a consequence to poorly maintained trains. 
I was dry before I bored this delayed service and now I am drenched.

The one perk to this most recent journey is the conductor / attendant his interaction with passenger throughout the journey was a pleasure to engage with and reassuring. He was disheartened by the diabolical conditions of the train.
This colleague is a prime explanation of good customer service, and has every right to protest for a fairer pay - I truly support them in this. 
The people at the top of EMR  need to give themselves a true head wobble! 

Asides a good portion of your staff, your fee and train services are shocking! 
If I had alternative measure to travel I sincerely would!

items.title: Horrible train company
items.review_text:
Horrible train company! 
90% of the time their trains are running late or cancelled at the last minute. 
If you apply for a refund for a ticket you’ve been unable to use, you’ll get some rubbish £ back. 
I hope they will be replaced by a serious company!!

items.title: It's a terrible experience today with…
items.review_text: It's a terrible experience today with EMR , 16 October 2022 train from London St Pankrac at 20.02 to Sheffield. It's must be 10 couches but come only 5 couches (((( wt...f...... People pay lots of money to sit in floor with is absolutely terrible!!! But don't forget strike again, we are support you.  ( Sarcasm!!!!! )

items.title: Trains are consistently filthy
items.review_text: Trains are consistently filthy, staff at the station local to me are rude and never seem to open the ticket office. There are always plenty of revenue protection staff on the trains but very few staff that actually want to assist with anything.

items.title: One of the most expensive train lines…
items.review_text: One of the most expensive train lines in the UK. Rarely runs on time. Dirty carriages that don’t get cleaned regularly, I can understand them being worn but could do with an update. Inflexible tickets and overpriced same day return tickets. Seat booking system rarely works so don’t rely or pay extra for this. Poor communication of rules between office/platform staff and onboard staff, to make you pay for additional tickets onboard which feels like a scam. Unfortunately I travel on this line for work 1-3 days per week and have considered moving house purely not to use it.

items.title: Ticket! But NO Wifi!
items.review_text: I love it how the ticket controller demanding the ticket every day but the wifi never works....and they do absolutely nothing about it...btw. reported the non working wifi at least 10 times in the last 6months!

items.title: I was surprised on a long haul 6 hour…
items.review_text: I was surprised on a long haul 6 hour train ride that it was like a tram. I can put up with that but what I can't is how disgusting it was. Sticky trays, litter, seats that haven't been cleaned in years. Dust and grime everywhere.

items.title: Rubbish experience compared to Avanti…
items.review_text:
Rubbish experience compared to Avanti trains 
hardly 1st class 
breakfast a reheated saugsage in a stale roll ...

items.title: Avoid!
items.review_text:
Sept. 19. 5.51 PM Liverpool to Manchester. Delayed 42 mns. More than total estimated time whole journey.
This was first and last time with EMR.
Avoid!!

items.title: Sloppy service and ripped off
items.review_text:
Since July, the use of EMR services has become regular for me due to work and leisure purposes but this is in contrast to their irregular services. Trains are often delayed, cancelled or way behind schedule to and from my departure and arrival stations. Recently, I had a delayed train and followed the procedure for the Delay Repay scheme to get a refund and was only awarded a refund of 12.5% of my return ticket price for a 15+ minute delay.

Considering my train was delayed to depart by 30 minutes, I find it disgusting to only have been given a refund for a delay of between 15 and 29 minutes. The departure time was scheduled for 18:15 and the train didn't actually depart until 18:45, now I'm not a master in mathematics but even I know that is a 30 minutes delay, so to avoid myself getting annoyed trying to appeal, I just accepted this deceit and accepted my £2.93 refund. 

Also, this may not be down to EMR but worth a mention on how stations are changing platforms now and again which is awkward when you need to transfer from one train to another with only like 5 mins transfer time which is also often conflicted due to late arrivals.

Overall, the service is 'ok' but from a very unsatisfied customer.

Update: this company has the audacity to strike yet the services they are providing are very poor. Cancellations, delays, some very arrogant train conductors and staff. Are they surprised people refuse to use their services?

Update (16/10/22):
After they close down a major connection between Nottingham and Grantham for engineering works, it was good that rail replacement was arranged. However, when rail replacement arrive 6 minutes past its scheduled arrival time leaving a 4 minute transfer from Grantham entrance to Platform 3, I miss my connecting train by approximately only 30 seconds. Do these (EMR & rail replacement company) actually communicate at all? If they knew a bus was going to be slightly late then why not hold the train back by 5 mins maximum at least? Half the times their services are never on time so what difference would 5 mins have made?

I'll continue to update this review each time I use EMR trains just so the public can actually see how unacceptable this company is and its rail replacement companies too. Cannot keep treating passengers to this shoddy show of a service, something needs doing and don't get me started on them striking!

items.title: Train guards are so rude
items.review_text: Train guards are so rude. Will make you buy another ticket if you accidentally bought the wrong time even though it’s the same price. They are horrible

items.title: Micky mouse joke
items.review_text: Complete stock. Staff belittle you when it's crowded. As if we forget they hugger off on strike when they want a long weekend. The prices...... whole other story.

items.title: Get To Your Destination Quicker By Running A Mile When You See The Name EMR
items.review_text: Not worthy of a 1 Star. Poor service and no interest to improve it. Travelled on their services many times and it gets worse every time! Delays, dirty trains and stations, staff look miserable, disinterested and couldn't careless. Looking at the other terrible reviews, the hierarchy dont seem to be capable of sorting it. I now try to avoid this clapped out careless outfit by using LNER and others by driving and parking to the nearest station that these operators call at.

items.title: I was ashamed to arrive back at…
items.review_text: I was ashamed to arrive back at Manchester following a trip to Italy. We finally got the Norwich train on Monday 12th September which stopped at Sheffield. There was only 2 carriages - no room to move and we had to stand all of the way! Also it was raining inside - many people had clothes and bags wet!! Not acceptable and I was embarrassed to be British especially as overseas travellers where experiencing the same situation which is not good when they have just arrived in the country.

items.title: Revoke EMR's license to operate
items.review_text: Took the 21.45 train from St Pancras to Leicester yesterday 10th September arriving 11.32.  Was 30 min late leaving and 92 min late arriving finally getting in at 01.04 am.  It was full and the train was filthy.  I'd just come back from St Malo in France.  Trains were beautiful, clean, fast, on time.  What a difference.  I went to the EMR 'delay repay' website.  It is useless, impossible to use, for good reason - it means EMR never has to pay out.  Useless company, the government should revoke its license.

items.title: Dreadful organisation from preventing…
items.review_text: Dreadful organisation from preventing you boarding trains because of clueless staff to not refunding correctly on delay repay to exorbitant charging when the trains are half empty.

items.title: Where is my refund
items.review_text: Where is my refund? 😂. I have never experienced such incompetence in my entire life. Am I living in a parallel universe where all my messages are being sent straight to a recycling bin? Am invisible? Are my words invisible? Hello?.....enough with the sarcasm...although i would love to talk worh myself all day long. But i have to send a message to east mid......oh........sorry. so another 5 weeks have passed. No reply to my complaint. Still no refund in my bank after being told they would pay half my ticket prices back x 2 😂 I will be ringing again....and again...and again until I get my money. Hello? Is there anyone there? And they look at you gone out when you ask them questions. It's hilarious.

items.title: Dreadful service
items.review_text: Dreadful service. Twice in the last month I have had the misfortune to use their services, once from King's Coss to Hoveton, the second time from Edinburgh to Hoveton. Both journeys had several legs to them and the only leg which encountered a delay was on both the EMR legs, both signal failures and both in old rolling stock in 30 degree heat. The conductors on both occasions said we were entitled to a full refund as the delays were between half hour and 2 hours. EMR first blamed the other train companies on the other legs and forwarded my claim to them. Then when that didn't work they denied that there were delays even tho on one of the journeys 7 other trains were caught up in the delay. I would give zero stars if possible as this is the worst service I've received in 40 years of traveling. I dread having to use their services again.

items.title: Pretty dismal service
items.review_text:
A fateful morning on August 17th from Sheffield to London. I completely understand that the 2 to 3 hour delays were out of their control. What was in their control was communication, not for the first time have I been sat on a stuck EMR train without any clue what is happening.
To add insult to injury my delay repay claim was rejected. I can understand why, their shareholders come first, and if customers give up then it's win win. Having checked the Rail Ombudsman web site it appears I have to wait 40 days before I can raise a complaint. I have stuck a reminder in the diary and held onto my tickets.
Even if you have purchased your tickets through the EMR web site they will still ask for details and copies of your tickets. When I was delayed on LNER, they messaged me immediately after the delay and simply confirmed where I wanted the refund sent to, ever so painless. EMR seem to have designed their process around avoiding payouts.
As far as travel it's a reasonable service although a virtual monopoly for Sheffield to London unless you wish to take the slow train to Doncaster and change there. It's in need of modernisation but the seats are relatively comfortable. For years I travelled first class but the deals are few and far between and it really isn't value for money. A token food offering and marginally more spacious seats, really not worth the money. If two of us are travelling then we now drive and park outside the congestion zone, it's cheaper and more flexible.

items.title: Do I really have to give 1* they don’t…
items.review_text:
Do I really have to give 1* they don’t deserve it, trip Norwich to Ely and return on August 11th both trains delayed, and when you fill in the delay repay form you are told this takes up to 10 days ? Why so long, 
 The trains are noisy dirty,uncomfortable and without air 
conditioning. I think this is the worst railway I have travelled on anywhere in the world , they never run on time, never able to get a snack or drink , and the staff want a rise ! Appalling service but if you don’t drive, which I don’t because of poor sight you are STUFFED !

items.title: The train was late
items.review_text: The train was late. It often is. The aircon blasted horribly cold air for half the journey. As usual. The seat was extraordinarily uncomfortable. No seat reservations. Again, nothing unusual there. The train had incessant beeps and alarms and inane announcments. They are very expensive too. The only thing they have going for them is the people who work there are usually pretty cheery

items.title: Worst UK train company
items.review_text: I have lived across the UK: Bristol, Reading, Manchester, Glasgow and now Loughborough. EMR is the worst train company I have used by a very long way. Daily delays, weekly cancellations, dirty trains, careless staff and a refund system that doesn't work.

items.title: Travelling to Norwich from Liverpool is…
items.review_text: Travelling to Norwich from Liverpool is the worst experience We have ever had to endure on EMR trains .. Over crowded on one of the hottest days at a weekend too , people leaning all over you , packed in like sardine DREADFUL .. Coming back over 40 mins late no Air Conditioning the tannoy speak inaudible so not aware of what is happening as to why we are running behind schedule.. Why is the OMBUDSMAN !!! not LOOKING into this DIABOLICAL Service …

items.title: Worst train service experienced worldwide
items.review_text:
Always a disappointment so far.
40% of the trains are cancelled or simply have no drivers available.
So far had to spend over £100 for taxi to avoid missing a flight and missed two meetings because of cancelled trains and all that in the past 6 months with EMR refunding £10 ish for the inconvenience....
However missing my train by 10min and getting the next one costs me £54 in addition to the already paid for ticket.
Outrageous...

items.title: Journey overall was a normal train…
items.review_text:
Journey overall was a normal train journey but the train manger jade (Sheffield accent ) on the 4:01 train out of Sheffield going to london st Pancras she helped make a long journey fast having a laugh being friendly in general the girl deserves a pay rise 

From the 2 millwall fans

items.title: Still waiting for a reply about my…
items.review_text: Still waiting for a reply about my refund of £10.60 and my complaint. Been waiting a good few weeks now for this to be resolved. It blows my mind how these companies go on strike. Not just once but multiple times at one of the busiest times of the year. O could understand it If they provided a good service. But they provide a terrible service and want more pay 😂. I missed a nights work because you couldnt arrive at your destination after being mislead on the train. The guy on the train was to scared to tell us all the truth. So he led us on making out we would stop at Grantham. Then ended up at bottersford and I miss out on work to and that night would have paid my weekly rent just about. So thanks east Midlands railway. The only reason you dont give a damn is because people are forced to use your service as its the only way to get around by train in the east midlands. Bunch of clowns. And they dobt even reply to emails or reviews. It just shows that they dont care and they are laughing at customers

items.title: An absolute nightmare of a company to…
items.review_text: An absolute nightmare of a company to work for! If I could give them a 0 star review I would of. Too many chiefs not enough Indians. Why does one company need so many self important, stuck up their own backside, narcissistic individuals? They really have no people skills, ability to manage their staff to behave in an acceptable manner.

items.title: Absolutely terrible service.
items.review_text:
Absolutely terrible service.
Trains are rarely on time, anywhere between 10 and 15 minutes daily. Always overcrowded. 
Update. 30.1.23
After spending too much money on alternative transport due to strike action and  late or cancelled trains, I decided to change jobs and work nearer to home. Took a pay cut in doing this, but now not spending £2k a year on trains and alternatives and have got over 2 hours a day back in my life. Priceless.

items.title: Absolutely horrendous journey from…
items.review_text: Absolutely horrendous journey from Nottingham. EMR are aware that there have problems on other lines and there is increased demand, they announced it....so why oh why would you not put additional carriages on. Just one additional would have made all the difference. No consideration for customers.

items.title: EMR bad service provider
items.review_text:
Firstly, who at EMR is responsible for reading reviews and answering some common questions? Either, like their service, they are not bothered or have no customer service, which fair enough is self evident, as if you want to get hold off someone then make sure you’re ready to speak to someone in India trying to relay current information and give advice that to be honest is lost in translation and frustration. Called to complain about cancelled trains and all I got was, but Sir you can take the next one! REALLY! Well I never. I said what if the next train is cancelled, oh but no Sir it’s not cancelled! Can you guarantee that? Oh yes Sir.
 One hour later. Train cancelled, called and I can take the next train! So the moral is, when you call to complain you are told politely that you can take the next train! And by all accounts trying to get a refund is as difficult as everyone says here. Anyway, try speaking to one of the two girls in customer service at Nottingham train station in-between their tea and chat! No chance. Same arrogance on line with principles of EMR. So how do they get away with it?! Because they can.  Because we don’t het listened too and we need to get to work to pay the bills.

items.title: B'Sh!t service and such a complicated website
items.review_text:
The train journeys are usually good but when you need to claim for a delay the website is impossible to navigate and even manual form filling is not possible. The refund process should be managed by EMR and not rely on the customer to have to claim.
I think EMR just make the process so hard you want to give up claiming. Even with the fuel cost it would be cheaper to drive and way more convenient than this B'sh!t.

items.title: It is a shame you can't give less than…
items.review_text: It is a shame you can't give less than 1* as this company is an absolute disgrace along with its staff members who are obviously trained to try intimidate their customers. A month or so ago I was unjustly given a penalty fare notice and have thus far appealed it twice unsuccessfully. They have turned a blind eye to their own legislation-The Railways Regulations 2018 or any of the evidence I have provided which i deem more than sufficient. The railway minister herself said that I should "feel confident that the appeals system will recognise an honest mistake and treat you fairly". This, unfortunately, could not be any further from the truth. You only have to look at the poor trust pilot rating for this company. They basically have a monopoly on the market so they do not care- they don't even respond to customers reviews!!! I use this service regularly to see family members but will most certainly be looking at alternative routes. Let's see how my third appeal with the independent panel goes....

items.title: I travel on the EMR regularly
items.review_text:
I travel on the EMR regularly. 
My main issue how poor the service is, for example the heating is off in the winter and the heating is on in the summer! It’s now just funny. No aircon…the staff are terse and you get the impression they are an entitled group who have a distaste for the public. 
I hope it’s not the case the driver /guards manipulate the heating on purpose. 
Love them!

items.title: Do not travel with EMR
items.review_text: Do not travel with EMR! I booked my son a surprise trip to London for his 18th birthday. We got to Nottingham on 2nd July 2022 to be told our train wasn’t on so we had to get a train to Luton, wait for a bus service to Hitchin and then get back on the train to st Pancras London. This added over an hour onto our journey. No details of any delay/service problems on my app/ tickets…coming home was even worse. We arrived at st Pancras to return to Nottingham 3rd July, we were sent to a platform that was closed to be told we had to go to kings cross station and get on a LNER train to Grantham and not to speak to anyone, just get on the train…again no details of anything on my app/ticket/journey..we tried to get on this train but every seat was reserved. We got off the train after being confronted by some passengers & I asked for help. I told the LNER worker was the EMR guy at st Pancras had said..shown him my ticket and he radio’d for assistance. I was in a panic because I genuinely thought we were stranded there. We’d been sat in the station for hours, on the floor, it was so busy and we didn’t know what to do. The guy from LNER was extremely helpful - he let us get on that train in first class…we arrived at Grantham and had to wait approximately 45 minutes for a train to Nottingham and then we arrived at Nottingham and had to wait an hour for a train to Mansfield. The whole getting to London and getting back was a nightmare. Not once has my tickets changed or have I been informed of any of this. It was a nightmare! I paid over £100 for our tickets and the delay/refund drop down is rubbish and they don’t do any sort of complaints and delays/cancellations over the phone - what a shock!! I want my money back and quite frankly I’d like an apology for absolutely rubbish service!!!!

items.title: Absolutely rubbish
items.review_text: Absolutely rubbish. booking ticket system not allow you to cancel transaction even when you make mistake. more then month asking customer service to refund me and still not refunded.

items.title: Consistent with other reviews the…
items.review_text: Consistent with other reviews the trains are old, poorly maintained and generally filthy throughout. Seats caked with years of grime and an unpleasant odour throughout (the latter hasn’t changed since these trains were originally run by Virgin many years ago but has got worse). Avoid if you can but if you have to then travel outside of peak hours to avoid dirty, hot standing room only trains.

items.title: 45 minutes delay from boston to…
items.review_text: 45 minutes delay from boston to grantham causing me to miss 2 connections and my eurostar, costing me 200euro to change that. impossible to get a phone contact and absolutely no answer to mails. Horrid service

items.title: Absolutely terrible!
items.review_text:
Absolutely terrible! I was hoping the franchise would improve when it swapped from EMT to EMR but it's just got even worse.

After the mess that was EMR's handling of match day trains for Forest's trip to Wembley, it's now proving impossible to claim via Delay Repay:

1. I can't use the website to make the claim because it doesn't recognise my journey details.
2. I spent over an hour queuing on the phone. At first, I was told I'd have to go back to the point of purchase, despite the point of purchase being EMR's website. Then, the agent spent ages taking some details and told me they'd get back to me the next day - I still haven't heard anything a fortnight later.
3. I e-mailed EMR on 8th June and received an e-mail advising I need to register the claim online, even though I'd explained in the e-mail that I had already tried - clearly "Rose" didn't read my e-mail properly and just sent a stock e-mail.
4. Every time I try calling, I'm kept on hold for a ridiculous amount of time. It takes 5-10 minutes for the queue to go down by 1 person, which tells me there's only ever 1 person manning the phones.

The trains are always dirty and strewn with rubbish, regardless of which service I use. On two recent journeys, there's been no water and soap in the toilets, just an empty bottle of hand sanitiser.

items.title: All the good things are gone.
items.review_text:
Journeys by the new EMR trains are no longer an enjoyable start and end to any outing. 
There are no tables, either between seats or in seat backs, contrary to the misleading adverts showing them.
Perhaps a glass of wine on the way home; try to uncap a small bottle, pour some into a glass, hold filled glass while trying to recap bottle and replace in bag, all without a handy table. Or explain to a child that they have a 70 minute trip but nowhere to draw or play a game. And forget using a laptop and referring to notes.
It does work well, though, where two rows of seats face each other with a gap where the table should be - as evidenced on my journey the gap is just the right size to sit on one side and prop feet on the other.
There is no longer the option of First Class. Where it has gone on the St Pancras/Corby line I don't know but it was another sometime treat which has disappeared.
As stated by someone else, there is no way to know which seats are booked and which are free.
Catering has gone but I am hoping this is temporary because of Covid.
Train journeys used to be fun, now they are to be endured
In fairness, the trains were clean and on time.

items.title: Train from Nottingham - St pancras London (26/05/22)
items.review_text:
What a shambles!! After travelling with EMR regularly, I am shocked with my experience today. 

In summary, seat reservations were not displayed above seats, so naturally people sat where there is space including myself as my seat was taken already. There were plenty of seats not in use for others. 

On arrival to Kettering, the most unpleasant and obnoxious couple boarded, had the most entitled attitude I had the displeasure of witnessing and were shouting at passengers, demanding people to move out of their reserved seats, meaning an elderly couple then had to give up their seats and relocate. Where did common decency go? If it wasn’t for the generosity of other passengers, this couple wouldn’t have been able to sit together for the duration of their journey. I am absolutely appalled - is this how the older generation is treated?! In the end, this disgraceful couple got their demand and other passengers actively moved away from them and sat in any random seats, I myself moved to another carriage, as they made everybody uncomfortable and frankly angry. I understand such rude people can not be avoided, however it seemed as if the staff on board had no idea how to handle this kind of situation I would expect for a train provider to be more organised and learn how to deal with disruptive and inappropriate passengers appropriately. As a young female who regularly travels alone, it is this kind of behaviour and this failure of management that leaves me doubtful to use this service as regular. 

I hope that this can be dealt with better in any future similar situations!

items.title: EMR ARE FANTASTIC
items.review_text: The emr team that helped me today were so helpful I'm grateful for the amount of help due to reduced mobility.

items.title: Such bad Customer Service- Avoid
items.review_text: I purchased my 2 tickets via Trainline, but our train arrived 48 minutes late on the Skegness to Grantham line on the 9th May 2022. causing us to take alternative trains etc. On EMR Website there are no facilities for e-tickets. So remember this next time you need to buy tickets. Maybe get printed out tickets. Trainline will only deal with cancellations. They even phoned EMR to try and sort it out but came up against a brick wall. The link they sent me you have to be a season ticket holder which I am not. It won’t back date my claim to the 9th May 2022. All EMR keeps saying under data protection even when I sent them all my paperwork my receipt and even a piece of paper from the Grantham station chap explaining that out train was delayed by 48 minutes they refuse to deal with me.

items.title: The worst company in existence
items.review_text: The worst company in existence. Don't bother using these liabilities because most of the time you'll either have to stand next to an open toilet or not even be able to get on the train at all due to it being cancelled. Staff are awful, rude and unprofessional, services are painfully crap, overpriced tickets for what? Might as well be throwing money away. If i had a choice to choose these or walk, you bet i'd be getting a good exercise session. Stay away!

items.title: Absolutely avoid
items.review_text:
I've gotten to the point where I actively avoid tickets that have a connection via EMR, and you should too. Here's why:

- Frequently cancelled trains. From my experience alone, they've cancelled around a half of every trip I've taken with them.

- They will let you wait before cancelling. Was on one of their trains. Waited 10-15 minutes after the departure time, they then decide to announce the service is cancelled due to there being 'no available driver'. Why they waited 10-15 minutes to declare this is absurd. This meant I missed my connection train, and an alternative train I could've taken.

- Trains are filthy, old and way too small. Seriously. I've seen steam trains less filthy (and more reliable!) than these.

- Always take the minimum amount of carriages for a trip. It's genuinely like they only have 2 carriages in service in the entire Midlands, it's crazy, they'll turn up with 2 carriages (with driver seats on either end, so not full) and expect this to satisfy a service with 12 stops.

Glad to hear this useless excuse for a train company is being bought out and hopefully fully engulfed by Greater Anglia.

items.title: EMR and Trainline do not deserve customers
items.review_text: If I could leave zero stars I would. On Sunday I left a review on the uncaring money grabbing attitude of EMR and Trainline. After numerous phone calls to Trainline and contacting EMR via twitter, neither company admits liability to non received tickets. They will not issue more replacement tickets or give a full refund. We have lost £113 and have been told that if we book again for a higher amount they would consider refunding the money from the original booking. A sorry from EMR on the original review will not make our family member’s day trip to London one to remember. Thanks

items.title: What a joke
items.review_text: What a joke, today I caught the 14:35 from St Pancras to Sheffield only 5 coaches on this train, no seats and with 15 other passengers who were coughing and sneezing and spreading god knows what,  I was sat on the floor with my 4 year old little boy, buffet car not working. I’ll be using my car from now on, I paid £60 to sit on the floor. Don’t use the train use your car it’s more convenient and more hygienic

items.title: Absloute joke of a company I boarded…
items.review_text: Absloute joke of a company I boarded the 15.33 from Stoke  which didn't arrive until nearly 15.43 so already running late, pulls into Derby I'm not sure of time but was stationery on the platform for ages and didn't leave until 15.31 the time it was meant to be getting into long Eaton, no apology for the train crew of the late departure and when I asked the guard about what time it would be getting into long Eaton and about my connection he wasn't forthcoming with and apology or a reason for it in fact he just told me the time it would be getting in and then cleared off, very poor customer service all round!!!!

items.title: On the 16th of April at 1645 we boarded…
items.review_text:
On the 16th of April at 1645 we boarded a 4 car train to Chesterfield in order to get back to London.
The 4 car train probably had 750 people on it, the ManU game had finished 1.75 hours earlier - these 750 people had to mostly stand for 1 hour whilst the Trans Pennine Espress managed 25mph. Fortunately the train didnt crash but theres a possibilty all now have covid- why the operator didnt make this a 8 car train concerns me - they knew their was a major football game in Manchester on Saturday afternoon. 
Inept management, Even in London one does not get such poor service.

items.title: The rolling stock is old
items.review_text: The rolling stock is old, but not an excuse for the dirty carriages. Disgustingly dirty: the floor and seat back obviously had not been cleaned in some time. Avoid this line if possible. Other rail lines take pride in the state of cleanliness of their rolling stock.

items.title: Got cheap tickets (under £10) but…
