items.review_text: Got cheap tickets (under £10) but realised I’d booked them the wrong way around. Called customer service and was told I can’t get a refund because my tickets were <£10 and I had to buy new tickets which were over £20

items.title: Booked advanced tickets to Liverpool…
items.review_text: Booked advanced tickets to Liverpool Monday till Wednesday, unfortunately EMR cancelled all trains because of bad weather, we were told that we could use our tickets for the following day which was Tuesday,that was a bit of an inconvenience but we were quite happy to do that instead of a refund, that was because we'd booked our hotel room and we would have lost over £140 if we'd cancelled our room,then we found out on the Tuesday we were travelling that the original return tickets for Wednesday couldn't be used on Thursday so we had to purchase two more return tickets, so we were penalised by EMR because they cancelled their trains, talk about being ripped off, and to make things worse the staff at EMR where not very unhelpful,  but I think that's because they don't have a clue about EMR cancellation policy

items.title: Too many 1st class cars, poor wifi!!!
items.review_text:
Friendly staff, but bathrooms often poorly maintained and wifi is useless.  New trains are much less comfortable than thr old ones.

Biggest criticism is the ridiculous ratio of 1st class to standard cars.  Sometimes 50/50, with 1st class nearly empty and standard packed in like sardines.  Just awful!!!!

items.title: Thank you!
items.review_text: I'm really grateful to East Midlands Railway for getting us to London on Friday, despite the Storm Eunice chaos. We travelled on the 10:00 service from Sheffield to London St. Pancras and despite the journey time being twice as long, and the train being very overcrowded, it was comfortable enough and we were so grateful to get to London. We had a show booked on Friday evening which couldn't be moved, thank you to EMR for getting us there in good time. The only reason for deducting one star is due to a rude member of staff at your Sheffield ticket office who told us we wouldn't make it to London and we were stupid to try - totally unnecessary scaremongering when we were already stressed enough. I understand you were advising against travel, however, some circumstances don't allow for plans to be moved.

items.title: Useless unhelpful disgusting
items.review_text: I wouldn’t even give them one star.Got a smart card when 1st came out & told if lose it funds are protected. Post covid they introduced flexi ticket-great! so 1st time lost card- i report it & order a new one but had nothing but trouble trying to get my remaining credits back. they said they would email me replacement tickets - no email rocks up so have to buy as customer service useless. i’ve emailed, no response, been to ticket office & they’re not trained to deal. One member of staff was patronising & referred me to T&cs on flexi ticket in that they can’t transfer funds from lost to new smart card - oh and apparently the t&cs on flexi card are different but they neither draw your attention to it, it isn’t in smartcard literature & isn’t there at point of sale so my view is they can’t incorporate that into the contract- absolute useless bunch of cowboys

items.title: Shocking service
items.review_text: Shocking service. Spend a small fortune on a 1st class ticket and get told when you get on there’s no catering available. I’ve been on trains in India and had better service. FYI the train was the 17.25 from Derby to London St Pancras on 13/2/22

items.title: Man at Nottingham Station was amazing! (6/2/22)
items.review_text: Man at the customer service help desk on Sunday 6th February was fantastic! This was at 9:30am in the morning, he was able to help and get us back on track for our journey! Thank you.

items.title: Disgusting staff and predatory policies
items.review_text:
Non-mask wearing staff just called the police on and removed a single black mother from the train after messing with her belongings when she momentarily returned to her seat between being shouted at because she was using the toilet.
The lies they tell the media about understanding innocent mistakes regarding daily tickets do not reflect the predatory rules they rigidly enforce.

items.title: Woman at the Kettering booking office…
items.review_text:
Woman at the Kettering booking office clearly doesn’t understand what invisible illnesses are because someone has a disabled railcard and isn’t in a wheelchair it means they’re ok 

Also get rid of the pumpkin franchise 
If you want food poisoning or to pay £2 for a 60p bag of crisps shop with them

items.title: Not bad they are getting there.
items.review_text:
I have always found EMR staff to be the majority of times pleasant and kind whilst using their service. Their trains a generally clean obviously even more so during the Covid-19 era.

More carriages on some routes or times good make the service much much better.

items.title: Serious Overcrowding during Covid 19
items.review_text:
I travelled to London on the 20th November leaving at 10.13 from Chesterfield 
It was announced  on arrival that the train had left the depot with two carriages short and EMR were fully aware of the fact .
Despite tens of tens of passengers pushing furiously to get on the train at each and every stop the train kept stopping and allowing passengers on .The gang ways and exit areas were full to capacity with people standing two or three depth .The distance between each other was in most cases zero cms .  At no point did EMR by pass stations and  we stood the entire two hour journey in this state .The reply I received today when I complained about the risk to public safety in doing this was as follows .
Basically it is not EMR responsibility to enforce social distancing and mask wearing so hence it is deemed to be mine  the individual  and that if this was the case  I  should have alighted the train if it felt unsafe .At no point was there any reference to a duty of care they have to passengers or the prevention of a  potential hazardous situation .Shame on you EMR

items.title: Shameful service for disabled customers
items.review_text:
I booked tickets with EMR well in advance with reserved seating. I have a disability which causes debilitating fatigue and issues with balance and co ordination so reserved seating is a must for me.

Both inbound and outbound journeys failed to be marked as reserved, despite my ticket clearly showing the train time, coach and seat references. EMR had just not marked them as reserved on the screen. This led to my seat being occupied on both legs abd me having to ask them politely to vacate my seat. On the return journey a young lady outrightly refused to move, despite my ticket proving the reservation, based on the seat not being updated as reserved. If EMR had not let me down this wouldn’t have happened.

I booked my tickets 3 days in advance so there was no reason or excuse for this. How can I trust EMR not to put me in this horrible situation in the future? This isn't just a minor inconvenience for people with disabilities, it’s crucially detrimental to health and wellbeing. Dreadful service to disabled customers, you should be ashamed.

items.title: Bad and worst experience today train…
items.review_text: Bad and worst experience today train was delayed and they also refused to give me refund

items.title: Ignorant staff
items.review_text:
I was waiting for the first train from Wellingborough 04:48 when with just 1 minute to go there was a platform change from 4 to 2. Passengers were running to try to get over to platform 2 when the Train manager shut the doors and tried to depart. 
Someone held the doors open to allow a number of passengers to get on the train. When the train Manager came through to check tickets he was not very nice complaining about holding the doors it was pointed out about the platform change he wasn’t interested saying the train would be late.The train arrived 9 minutes EARLY at Bedford sat in the platform for 12 minutes and left 3 minutes late. This is not the first time this has happened as customers have had the same problem the week before ,they tried to get on the train the Train Manager asked them to step back from the train and when they did the TM just departed the train knowing full well how long it is for the next one.
The next train from Wellingborough for those who missed this train due to the ignorance of the train Manager is 67 minutes away if it’s on time.When I complained to EMR they were not one bit interested saying the Train Manager was not allowed to make the train late. I was always under the impression that the train service is there for the customer paying nearly £7,000 per year for a ticket I for one will be communicating by car when my season expires EMR connect are a joke and most of the staff (not all) are awful.
The trains are uncomfortable unreliable 20 year old junk as they are always being cancelled or being run as a 4 car in peak time using the excuse that the train has developed a fault ridiculous.

items.title: Pathetic refunds system.
items.review_text: They state to claim refund for trains delayed.. rubbish service. Impossible to claim any refund, online doesn't work, keeps coming up with red error messages, they don't do refunds over the phone. Misleading messages sent out. Wasted my time trying to get a refund. Absolutely pathetic.

items.title: Appalling conditions
items.review_text:
St Pancras to Derby, Sunday 14 November 2021 Scheduled departure 14.59.
Knowing that seat reservations were unavailable on Sunday departures to Derby from St Pancras, we arrived at the platform about 30 minutes before scheduled departure. The train was already quite full but we did manage to find seats for our party (3 adults, 2 children). By the time of scheduled departure the aisles were filled with standing passengers as were the doorway areas by the toilets.
Because of the delayed arrival of the train manager, the train’s departure was delayed by 25 minutes. During this waiting time, announcements were made advising passengers to transfer, if possible, to a Nottingham train, which, at ten carriages was twice as long as ours. Putting a five carriage train on a busy Sunday afternoon service is unacceptable.
As the journey progressed, some of our party went towards the toilet but found it very difficult first to squeeze past standing passengers then because of passengers sitting, and, in one case, sleeping in the doorway area. After leaving Long Eaton, the last stop before Derby, I went to the doorway luggage rack to sort out our suitcases. Because of the standing passengers this was a very difficult task and I only just completed this before the train reached Derby.
The whole journey had been a very unpleasant experience. I am a frequent user of public transport (buses, trams and flights) and in none of these do I experience anything approaching the unregulated overcrowding which is seemingly the norm on your services. Your trains are also the filthiest means of transport. The seats are uncomfortable and dirty. The toilets are uncleaned. The floors are filthy The bins are overflowing. We noticed arriving at St Pancras on our outward journey that passengers were boarding our train as we left the train meaning that there was no scope for cleaning the train between journeys.
Your fares are also mile-for-mile the most expensive.
Your company has taken on the East Midlands franchise fairly recently. You should not have taken it on if you did not feel you would be able to provide a satisfactory service. If there were problems when you took it over you have had time to rectify them.

items.title: Usual rubbish
items.review_text: Seat reservations not showing, too cold, £2.40 for a tea, pitifully slow WiFi.

items.title: This evening Stoke to Derby service
items.review_text: This evening Stoke to Derby service. Several passengers with their feet on the seats. In front of EMR staff  who was not bothered (still told about this useless 3S through the microphone). I have seen dogs on seats in the past as well. Filthy carriages. Prefer to keep standing rather than to sit.

items.title: Where is my EMR train from Derby to…
items.review_text:
Where is my EMR train from Derby to Sheffield? It's the shxxy brown one coming round the bend now! Do they ever wash the outside of their trains????? 
Awful experience!

items.title: Skegness to Nottingham train didn't turn up 7.09a.m Aug 17th 2021.no refund given!
items.review_text: The train didn't turn up.lady gave me and the wife claim forms,we both filled the forms in and sent them off,I eventually got my refund and wife didn't.she said she filled in form the same as me but when I contacted e.m.r they said train was only 3 mins late.it never turned up we waited over an hour for next train.when that train eventually turned up it only had two carriages instead of usual four.this train had to carry two train loads of people plus a cricket crowd.people were standing in the aisle,it was packed.emr don't seem to worry about COVID.terrible company!

items.title: Horrendous service
items.review_text: Horrendous service. Used to be one of the best in the country but the decimation of service times, train quality, journey length and reliability have taken their toll on the Service. Wellingboroughs south bound service needs urgent over turning. Prices are still inflated for a county service too which is now a commuter one. Abhorrent company.

items.title: Ticket prices are ridiculous staff are useless and don't care about customers.
items.review_text: Tickets are ridiculously over priced. £70 for a single from Nottingham to London? R U OK?! you'd think when a company is earning so much from ticket prices they would invest some of that into training their useless unhelpful staff properly. Although his underling begged me not to and told me he was his friend, I will be putting in a complaint about the supervisor I dealt with today (Michael) who was rude, unhelpful, shows no compassion at all and almost made me miss my train causing me to waste a further £65.

items.title: The worst experience of my life
items.review_text: The worst experience of my life. Got to the platform well before it was scheduled. Waited and waited, ask the staff they were completely useless. Then suddenly it just got cancelled no warning nothing. Avoid this train like at all cost!!!!

items.title: Extended journey times on old smelly…
items.review_text: Extended journey times on old smelly and uncomfortable trains, regular breakdowns and cancellations.

items.title: No compensation for delay
items.review_text: My train from Sheffield was 45 mins late. I was told I could claim ‘delay ‘ compensation. Entered my name email address and post code. I was asked to enter my home address either by choosing from ‘drop down ‘ or enter manually. But didn’t get a ‘drop down’ menu or anywhere to enter my address. So I was blocked from going any further. That’s one way of avoiding having to pay compensation. I did try 6 times more but got the same result. Very poor service.

items.title: Tried to get money back for over an…
items.review_text: Tried to get money back for over an hour delay on EMR train via Delay Repay form which I sent off with my tickets. There was a long delay before I heard back from EMR, then they said I hadn't included my ticket. I managed to get refund via Greater Anglia not EMR.

items.title: I would give 0 stars for this dirty sweaty train
items.review_text:
Used EMR from Ely to Manchester recently and was one of the worse journeys I have ever had on a train.

First struggled to find a seat as it is only 2 coaches and barely any space for luggage. As soon as you got on the train hot air hit you in the face. It smelled old, dusty and sweaty. The seats were old, stained and the trays were sticky and dirty. I immediately felt upset about the amount of money I spent on this train knowing I would have to sit in this for next 3-4 hours. It seemed that the air con was not working. It was clear to see that other passengers had complained and a member off staff put their hand up to the vent and said ‘air little is coming out’ and that there were no issues. That was that.

There were no charging ports and declined to use the toilets in fear of catching something. Mostly likely will never use this service again.

Only upside is that the train ran on time and the staff were very friendly.

items.title: Trains leave before departure time.
items.review_text: We arrived at the platform at 15.01, the train was due to leave at 15.02. The conductor wouldn’t let us on and the train left a minute early. I confronted someone at the station who told me they do set off one minute early. They don’t make this fact clear enough and it has massive consequences for us missing our next train. It meant I missed an important work meeting ultimately costing me hundreds of pounds.

items.title: If I could give 0 stars I would
items.review_text:
If I could give 0 stars I would. 

Had booked an advance single return for 3 people to london.  One of the party had symptoms for covid so rang to re-arrange.  We ended up changing the date- and being charged an admin fee of 10 pounds per ticket- so £60 in total even though its a return journey.  just could not believe that they would charge that much,  a lot of people would have gone screw it- I'm going even though I've got symptoms  just to not lose out on such money. It's irresponsible and just spiteful.  Never had an email to even confirm the cancellation- i can't even trust them to do that. And I had to rebook and pay first before cancelling.  Never, ever using them again.  Just awful. Why, as a business would you think anyone would use you again after this.

items.title: Regular traveller
items.review_text:
Regular traveller. 

Incompetent, from top to bottom. 

I now drive Lboro to Rugby every day then I don't have to dela with them. Recommend you do the same.

items.title: Expensive tickets
items.review_text: Expensive tickets. Not enough trains operating from St Pancras to Bedford and vice Versa. Not terrible but could be better.

items.title: First time travelling on EMR not even worth one star
items.review_text: First time travelling on EMR to Sheffield, train was dirty, plug sockets did not work, seats tatty and uncomfortable. Next time I will travel to Sheffield via Doncaster.

items.title: First Class? service on EMR
items.review_text: Travelled to London and back on Monday, First Class. Apart from the carriage being very empty (a bonus to staying safe in these times) this service was really bad. Offered one cup of tea and a biscuit on each leg of the return journey, train seats dirty (covered in crisps leaving London St P), staff care and pride in the First Class service low. On the return journey 2 members of EMR staff were also sitting in the first class car and getting better service with free drinks and snacks than the few customers. The price has stayed the same for this service but the level of customer care and the service provided has massively declined. The train on the return journey clearly had some sort of technical problem as when it reached a certain speed the carriage juddered so much - due to what feeled like something wrong with one of its wheels under where I was sitting - that it was impossible to work or drink the one cup of tea they had given me. I travelled first class so I could work on the train and this was not possible on the return journey due to this problem. Very very disappointed in EMR! Filed in the online questionnaire but I cannot imagine anything will result from that!

items.title: My train from London to Nottingham was…
items.review_text:
My train from London to Nottingham was delayed so I attempted to complete the online refund form. The form was - I found - difficult to use and then I was unable to post a photo of the ticket they required...Guess what? I had to complete the form again - tried twice more, but same thing happened. You don’t need to be Einstein to realise how good a way this is of increasing profits. Shame on them! Tried to call customer service, but it wasn’t toll free and anyway they were ''So busy'. Maybe the school holidays took them by surprise. 

Phil Lee

items.title: Broken trainset
items.review_text: It's almost imposible to have a NORMAL journey using EMR these days. Easy to blame Covid but it goes much deeper than that. Of the last six journeys one has been on time and with enough space to abide by distancing rules. A train from Skegness the other week was so rammed it was a joke. The announcer on the train even apologised for only being two carriages, he announced there were supposed to be four but he said he had no idea why two were taken off. Two other trips were delayed because staff were taking alloted breaks, another because there were insufficient staff and today we've been left sat on a platform for an hour on my daughters birthday before finding out online that the train had been cancelled after it broke down a couple of stops before ours. There was no info in the station, in fact the info board was just chucking out garbled info about nothing. I feel sorry for the staff who generally seem to be doing their best, a friend who works for them admits he's embarrased to tell people due to the amount of complaints he gets. Decent staff, dreadful company......oh and dont even start me on trying to get a refund!!!!

items.title: Fake announcements on PA and violating the rules for Covid-19, exposing everyone to the risk of contagion
items.review_text:
Long story short. Of my journey, one train was cancelled and the next one was in such a delay that we got stuffed like animals in 2 coaches on the first, already overcrowded, available train. On the PA was repeated several times that we could claim a compensation about the very poor travelling conditions on line or at the station. We did on line and, via the channel reserved to overcrowded trains, we were in contact with a Lady who kindly said: Sorry, it can happen. We don't compensate these problems. Full Covid lockdown and we were touching elbow and breathing the same air with dozens of people.
Claimed also the cancelled train and the delayed train, all at the origin of the overcrowding.
Cancelled train: reply, there was not enough evident quantified delay. How can you quantify a non existing train? Second one: not enough delay. Again, reason of overcrowding and I don't think the trains we were supposed to take are running with such frequency!! It is not the London underground....If we were passengers for 2 trains in the same one means that the delay passed the standard time schedule (I thin 1 train every half hour or more). 2 days ago I receive a new message. EMR cannot process my claim because I have not submitted spoiled tickets; I have to submit them within 7 days to validate my claim. I have already done TWICE. With patience, I tried to submit the spoiled tickets again today. Not possible, this claim is rejected, open a new one. First, if it was already rejected, why do you write to me? Second: I cannot open a new claim, the ticket was dated more than one month ago and these fraudulent gentlemen have spent one month asking documents I already provided....
What it is hurting is that they hope that, with their complexity and maze of unnecessary steps in the website, people gives up and they keep the money they don't deserve. They did not provide any service but posed the risk of a further contagion. Fortunately, I have my pride and time in my hands now. So, after being treated like cattle stock with the risk of Covid-19 and pulled around, I am not accepting it.

items.title: Anything but first class!
items.review_text:
I booked a theatre trip to London for my Mum and I to celebrate her 70th birthday. We travel from different places to London. For my Mum, in Nottingham, I booked her a first class ticket with EMR. I was able to book a LNER train. 

As it was a special treat I booked her first class tickets. I told her not to worry about taking food and drink because she was first class. 

She arrived at the station 30 minutes before it’s departure to enjoy the first class lounge. It was however closed with a sign saying closed at weekends. She called me to let me know and I told her not to worry as she’d get food and drink on the train in first class. She called me about 30 minutes into her train journey to say she’d been informed there were no first class services, such as food and drink, at weekends. 

My Mum called me during her journey highly distressed because it was so hot that day and she couldn’t even get water. People treat animals better than how EMR treated my Mum. 

At the time of booking I was not informed that these services were all unavailable. How can EMR charge first class knowing no facilities will be offered. If I’d known I’d have booked my Mum a standard ticket and told her to take her own food and drink.

Absolutely disgusting!!

items.title: Prices are ridiculous this company…
items.review_text: Prices are ridiculous this company should be on rip off Britain avoid using if you can use Avanti west coast or Lner tickets much cheaper and better service can get 1st class tickets for 1/2 the price of EMR standard class and the staff are much more friendly.

items.title: Virtually a monopoly on the route Derby…
items.review_text:
Virtually a monopoly on the route Derby to London and it appears they have taken advantage with ridiculously expensive fares to London St Pancras. eg. 2 people , Derby to London return £139
Advance fares are not much cheaper.
I have found its better to travel to Tamworth or drive to Lichfield and get the equivalent return journey into Euston for £60 , saving £79
Come on EMR get your act together or go out of business/lose the franchise.
Also notice that EMR have not replied to any feedback in the last 12 months so shows that they dont care and think their virtually monopoly business model is a good one as far as they are concerned.

items.title: Cancelled my train without telling me
items.review_text: Cancelled my train without telling me . Couldn’t give two craps down at the station . Wouldn’t refund me my ticket or pay for my taxi to try and catch my connecting train in derby . Tried to call them and you sit on hold for 40 minutes abs then give up . Awful . How they can get away with this I have no idea . Just spent 26 quid on a taxi to rectify the mistake

items.title: Moved to an area served by EMR having…
items.review_text: Moved to an area served by EMR having previously had the joy of Virgin/LNER. The trains are so dirty inside and a mess of a paint job on the outside. Every single train seems to have different colouring and wording. I think the wording makes sense in terms of type of journey, i.e intercity (longer) but also is a sign of the quality of the train, the regional being the worst of the worst. Sat on a regional today that was literally filthy and smelt like damp. Wouldnt dare use the toilets on these things. £160 rtn to London from Notts. Crazy money for sitting in filth.

items.title: This Train Company is Barely Fit to Operate.
items.review_text: The regional timetable changes on 19th June has forced me to commute from Newark to Spondon by car for the last three weeks.  Apparently there might timetable improvements starting on 19th July according the National Rail app but the EMR website still refers to the 19th June hatchet-job on the timetable.  What's going off, as I have no idea?  Also my delay repay is at 20 working day and has been paid to my PayPal but with a miss-spelled email address.  Heaven knows how long that will take to arrive.  In conclusion this train company is barely fit to operate.

items.title: Bringing the entire train network down
items.review_text:
Sat on the train waiting to depart when there is no staff to let us depart safely. Sat for over 10 minutes waiting with announcements from the train driver apologising as if it was their fault. 
Lack of staff at Nottingham station thanks to EMR. 
NOT impressed first cancel all the trains and give a copy and paste response from the website with no consideration for the distruption and now no staff to get cross country trains moving. 
Well done bring the entire train network to a halt while you figure out your business.
Bring in more staff to make a dedicated team to figure out why you can't have trains running on time ... Yeah great use of money that need more people to think why your service can't run

items.title: Not the best
items.review_text: I travelled 1st class to Sheffield from London. Train was quite old and it showed in the decor inside. I returned to London via LNER from Doncaster. Their product was substantially better and at the same price. Will be going to Nottingham in a few weeks. 1st Class LNER to Grantham from London is £59. Cheapest standard class EMR is to Nottingham is £70. Even getting a train to Nottingham from Grantham works out at the same total price and takes about 10 minutes longer. No brainer to me for the superior standard of train and facilities.

items.title: Rude staff
items.review_text: I paid for a ticket and on the way back the person who spoke to me was rude to me when her scanner wasn't working and tried to say i bought a dodgy ticket

items.title: Avoid! Avoid!! AVOID!!!!
items.review_text: If you want to be robbed by the dirtiest, most ramshackled trains with a staff of pantomime actors then you’re probably going to enjoy an East Midlands Railways. My overpriced journey to work throughout the pandemic has been more often than not on board a filthy or overcrowded East Midlands Railways train, a company who clearly values profit over your safety, I have found them to be dangerously unclean, flagrantly overpriced and obnoxious when it comes to complaints handling. I now find that by getting a slightly earlier train each day I can travel in safe, clean, comfortable conditions and save £750.00 a year. I suggest if you are planning to travel with East Midlands Railways, have a quick look see if there is an alternative route twenty minutes earlier which could save you a lot of money and a lot of stress.

items.title: Can not fault the team at EMR
items.review_text: Can not fault the team at EMR! I was on a train to Kettering when someone picked up my phone thinking it was lost. It was fortunately handed to a guard  at Leicester station. Thank you so much to James at Leicester and other colleagues on the train and at Kettering station who sent my phone back to me on the next train. You are all amazing!!!!!

items.title: Customer Beware
items.review_text: I purchased an open return ticket in good faith a couple of weeks ago (I checked the timetables when I booked to ensure services were operational). I was contacted this morning to alert me that due to engineering works my return journey (normally direct and around 1 hour duration) would involve FOUR changes of train and take around 3 hours. It is only a week from my intended date of travel. I applied for a refund and was charged £10 for the privilege of avoiding serious inconvenience!! So - I turned to Twitter to ask why this should be. The initial response could have been drafted by a robot (and probably was) in that it did not address my question at all. The second response was from a human. The third response was a “shoulder shrug” and a link to make a complaint! Unbelievably bad customer service. Frankly, I cannot be bothered to go through all that hassle for the sake of £10, but I can be bothered posting on here and Twitter to warn intending passengers of this sharp practice from EMR. They need to understand that regular commuters have long memories and plenty of alternative modes of travel. This incident has lost EMR literally £100’s. I hope they think it’s was worth it (if indeed they even bother to read reviews on here).

items.title: It is up to you to follow the…
items.review_text: It is up to you to follow the government rules. There were people not wearing facemask in a crowded train. I complained to a member of the staff and he said he couldn't ask them to put it on.

items.title: Dirty diesel, unnerving Covid policy.
items.review_text:
Train left on time. Reasonably clean and tidy. Polite staff. Arrived in Nottingham from London a few minutes late.
Two issues spoilt the journey. Firstly diesel fumes were present in the passenger compartment throughout the journey. I took the train in part to avoid using the car but was reminded what an environmental disaster these diesel trains are, and on this occasion bloody awful to be sat in.
Secondly the Covid policy of making everyone sit next to a window is poorly thought through. When we entered the train everyone spaced out. After repeated announcements we were forced to move. Couples are unable to sit side by side in 2 seat spaces instead having to sit facing one another in 4 seat spaces. But because all of the 4 seat spaces are clustered at the end of the carriage we moved from being perhaps 10-15 foot from the next nearest passenger to about 2 feet from the next nearest passenger, back to back, whilst the centre section of the carriage was empty. Announcements said that this was for the safety of people passing through the carriage but the only people moving through the carriage were ticket inspectors and potentially people going to the toilet, although on this journey no one left their seat. I fail to see how forcing people to sit clustered together for 2 hrs is safer than allowing the odd person to move through the carriage and momentarily pass another passenger en route to the toilet. Effective ticket inspection on entry and exit would negate the need for staff to move through the train during its journey. In any case staff still have to come within a few feet of passengers even if they are sat next to a window. This decision appears to be entirely revenue based, as a token gesture to staff expected to inspect tickets. However forcing staff to continue on board ticket inspections and the prioritisation of revenue over everyone's personal safety is distasteful and unnerving.

items.title: DIRTY TRAINS PRICEY FARES
items.review_text:
The service is getting worse since main review and they are being paid a management fee by the taxpayer so no longer care about collecting fares or cleanliness or passengers it seems. 
If you use delay repay expectat the 1st one to reject as does the second but then press the option for a human to review it. If they don't give you delay repay compensation as per their published scheme or refuse to repay for a taxi (if if train is over 2 hours late/cancelled or is last one of day) send your rejected claim to the rail ombudsman they reply flipping quickly to them and you soon get your money back and also let your Mp know how hopeless this firm are.  They gave the contract to them rather than renewing stagecoaches contract! 
The trains are dirty dated and something from 30 years ago (literally the carpets and seating has seen many a decade out) the previous company were not great but the carriages were modern and clean inside if not outside: this lot obviously hired the cheapest rubbish left for many of their local journeys. For some reason too lazy to open the windows so there is no ventilation or too mean to provide sanitiser on board so I no longer use the train . I value my health . Have complained to both company and DFT . Both bland replies .

items.title: Thieving dishonest immoral company …
items.review_text: This is one if the companies that is taking advantage of the covid19 pandemic to Rob customers blind and I do not understand why no one is regulating them. I bought a ticket on their site for my son to go to his dad in London, then the guidance came out saying only travel for urgent reasons because London is tier four. EMR refuse to refund the ticket or allow me to book for another date and stated that their service was running so I should have used the ticket. How is that fair? The government says no don't travel to London but according to EMR if you choose to follow the guidance you are out of pocket! These people are thieves!!

items.title: Absolutely disgusting
items.review_text:
Absolutely disgusting. Left me (a young female) at the train station, late at night, for almost 2 hours.
I understand when something happens trains get delayed and cancelled, but is there even a thought for passengers? No.
There was supposed to be a replacement bus service which never showed up.
No regard for consumers, no thoughts to young people left stranded, and no response when you complain.
Joke of a company, I really wish there was another train service I could use as I'm now ONLY travelling by bus or car.
Boycott EMR.

items.title: Atrocious
items.review_text:
Not even worthy of a bloody star. Speaks volume about the hypocrisy of this country’s filthy expensive infrastructure for sub par service. British INEFFICIENCY at her finest. Trying to balance the flagrant deficit by overcharging the consumers with hidden costs and a lack of flexibility, what a despicable sham.

Need a desperate restructuring of the entire company, actually this whole country needs a shake up. Shame

items.title: Couldn't run a p**s up in a brewery
items.review_text:
They wouldn't know the meaning of the word customer services if it was spelt out to them
Incorrect information given no compassion  charge 50% more than other companies and then say they all charge the same price  late trains  trains that  break down on  a regular basis , rude staff, dirty carriages  , just wish they weren't the only company that used my station

items.title: Website needs an upgrade. Customer service is bankrupt
items.review_text:
I was booking advanced single and while booking the website offered a first class upgrade for £3 which I ticked. I could not proceed and kept receiving error message E00328. Customer service was absolutely useless. I told them the error number. They didn't know what it meant and kept asking for screenshot which I didn't have. I don't know why EMR pretends to have a customer service, they might have as well don't bother.

Edit I got a reply apparently the tickets were no longer available even though I tried many times with the same price available and the same result. Obviously they did not offer the tariff I couldn't book. I guess they don't know about trading standard.

items.title: Profiteering from Coronavirus
items.review_text:
At the start of the lockdown I was unable to make a planned rail trip and so I requested a refund. At that time the advice was that tickets which had been received by post should be posted back for a refund and so I did so. Several weeks later, having not received a response or a refund, I checked the website to find that they now have an email contact address for refunds. When I contacted them they refused to refund me because I hadn't made an online request within 28 days. So EMR have decided to not bother dealing with postal requests for refunds and then deny refunds to those of us who have been patiently waiting for them to do their job.

Update: Having exchanged several emails of complaint EMR have said that they expect to check post over the next 10 days and have asked if I sent it recorded delivery. It seems that they're now preparing to deny my refund by saying that they didn't receive my letter. They have all the details of my journey, they know I booked the tickets, the tickets were clearly for a leisure journey for 2 people one of whom has a senior railcard, and as such the journey could not be taken under the rules of lockdown. There is no reason to refuse my refund!

items.title: EAST MIDLANDS RAILWAYS -  THE BRIGHTEST STAR IN DARK DAYS
items.review_text:
The Sales Support of East Midlands Railways, and the Special Assistance Team, are the Brightest Stars shining through the dark days of the corona virus problems. Their efficiency and speed in dealing with ticket refunds, and cancelled assistance on-line, proved to us how well deserving of praise and thanks every single staff member should have.. They must be inundated with applications for ticket refunds because of cancelled flights, and yet there understanding is 'outstanding' in every respect. Only hope the 'decision makers' of East Midlands Railways take note.
Truly grateful,
John and Joan Sadler.

items.title: I would give it 0 if I could
items.review_text: I would give it 0 if I could. Our train was overfilled with passengers from other trains as their trains had been cancelled. They were told which platform the train was before people who actually had the tickets for the train. Therefore we had to stand for a what should have been a 2 hour journey. On top of the fact we were standing with lots of others, we had a half an hour delay which meant we had to stand for 2 and a half hours in cramped spaces! For the price of the tickets this is absolutely ridiculous. After telling the customer services they simply said; there is no compensation for standing as you didn’t reserve a seat. 2 reasons I had a problem with this. When purchasing the ticket they did not mention that you may have to stand the entire time. The other reason is that they had no care for the fact there was essentially double the amount of people on the train due to cancellations of other trains. They have offered compensation for the delay only however, I think this is appalling! I 100% will never be travelling with EMR again. I would much rather pay a fraction of the price for a guaranteed seat on a coach even if it is a 4 hour journey instead!

items.title: Poor
items.review_text: Regular user of Liverpool to Thetford service over the years. Can’t believe how much it has declined in every way since the takeover by EMR. Trains dirty. Important announcements inaudible public display announcement board not working. Services sold as no change in fact involve unannounced and rushed dash at Nottingham to board another train. Disappointing as previous operator service was much better- how is this allowed to happen- surely things should improve. Get your act together EMR - this is not good enough

items.title: They've shrunk the seats and tables.
items.review_text:
They've shrunk the seats and tables.
The prices are ridiculously high. 
Transport for the masses is a joke. 
Government wants us to stop using the car? But let money grabbing companies hike prices cut costs to make more money.
I cannot wait to pass my test. 
It's cheaper to travel in a gas guzzelling car than public transport?! 
That's just a joke!

items.title: Nice staff, shame about the trains
items.review_text:
Not a reflection on the staff but the train carriages are now old and tatty (so much for the benefits of privatisation)
To be fair, the legroom is a bit better than many newer trains but what is the point of those reservation screens above the seats? I can't remember ever seeing them working. They'd be better to turn them off than have the misleading 'Not reserved' message. How that system isn't automated is beyond me but they're not the only train company for whom this seems beyond the scope of what is possible.

items.title: Best rail company in the UK
items.review_text: I travelled with them half the way between Brighton and on A business trip the interior is the same as East Midlands trains just different colours, But the service is Awesome this was one of the very few times my booked seat wasn't taken, and its my first time on EMR And the staff were friendly. I couldn't recommend this company highly enough 😃😃😃🚂
